reviews.text: Aesthetically the most confusing restaurant ever. Architecturally, it&#39;s a wonder that the Cheesecake Factory was ever made to look the way it does.<br><br>But it does.<br><br>Conceptually, The Cheesecake Factory&#39;s menu is elaborate... far too elaborate. It&#39;s like reading a novel just to figure out what you want to eat (which is really just a precursor to their namesake). <br><br>But they make it work, and I was surprised to find out that most of their meals are scratch-made.<br><br>But what this confusing, elaborate restaurant does is provide an experience that allows you to enjoy some decent (if not calorie-heavy) food, and make fun of the restaurant in sort of a meta &#34;I hate this, but I love it, so I&#39;m just kidding&#34; sort of way. <br><br>The food? Heavy. Depends on what you get in terms of heaviness, but there is no &#34;light.&#34; There is heavy, and there&#39;s heavier.<br><br>The Cheesecakes are the real beast here. Delicious, but impossible to choose. You can share, but who wants to? I go for chocolatey cheesecakes (Oreo especially), but the occasional plain vanilla is also enjoyable. I&#39;m happy to wait in line for a cheesecake, then make my wall through the mall. <br><br>It&#39;s never not busy, so getting a table can be a hassle. <br><br>It&#39;s also very, very dark at night, and hard to read the menu, even with glasses. A back-lit menu update would be great.

Happy New Year! The Cheesecake 30th Anniversary cake...What a dessert to end the year with in 2019. We decided to satisfy our sweet tooth while in Providence. Of course this place is always crowded but we opted to wait it out. <br><br>I&#39;m not going to lie as a rule I am not a big cheesecake person , so what am I doing here‍??? However I do like chocolate and chocolate in any shape works for me.   <br><br>Well our delightful server Harmony set me straight with the Anniversary cake.  It was awesome but missing a little something and that was nuts on top.  When I made the suggestion to Harmony she turned into a super hero and tracked down some slivered almonds for me to sprinkle on top.  Sheer Perfection. The cake and the service!<br><br>Oh yeah my husband had pineapple upside down cheesecake which he devoured in no time. Two big wins. <br>I highly recommend you stop in and try one of these delectable delights and ask for Harmony!

Huge fan of the cheesecake factory! I&#39;ve  never had anything on the menu that I didn&#39;t enjoy, kind of sad they removed the firecracker salmon appetizer from the menu, as that was always my go to! Recently tried the Cajun Jambalaya Pasta &amp; that is my new favorite. Always good service when I dine in at this location!
Our waitress was so so sweet with great energy and kindness! Food was delicious &amp; service was exceptional! Can&#39;t recommend the Cheesecake Factory enough especially this location.
I loved the service and attention from our waiter. Outstanding food. Parking was accessible. It is a great atmosphere.

So we have never eaten here because it&#39;s attached to the mall and we never go to the mall. Except for yesterday (3/16) so we decided to check it out. <br><br>Busy but only waited less than five minutes for a table. Our waiter was funny and I wish I could remember his name because he&#39;d get all the props. Our drinks came out promptly and we ordered fried zucchini as an appetizer. Guess who will be trying to duplicate these in her air fryer?! This girl. They were perfectly cooked and the ranch dressing was definitely not out of a bottle. <br><br>I ordered the white chicken chili. Amazing!!! Just spicy enough and decent enough size that I got to take some home. The man got buffalo chicken sandwich and he said the buffalo sauce was too mild but it was really good otherwise and he absolutely loved the ranch dressing. The boy got a kids mac and cheese which I was weary off because so many places serve Kraft. I can eat that at home for a dollar. I needn&#39;t have worried because it was definitely freshly made in house and enough left over for him to bring some home too.<br><br>The two cons I had were that we were seated next to the kitchen so it was extremely loud. It didn&#39;t bother me the entire visit but there were a few kitchen moments that made it ear shattering. And the price. I lost my mind at the price. While we both had two drinks a piece, the tab skyrocketed to 88.00. Even if we both drank water, it would definitely still be too expensive of a place for us to frequent which is a bummer because the menu was GIANT and the food was EXCELLENT. However I don&#39;t know that we will be back soon because that is definitely a &#34;treat ourselves&#34; kind of restaurant. Again, this bums me out. I know it&#39;s great quality food but I didn&#39;t expect to spend that on a lunch time meal. <br><br>Anyways, if management reads this and can figure out who our waiter was, I will edit this and tell you that you need to ask to be seated in his section (he complimented the man&#39;s tattoos and T-shirt...that should narrow down who our waiter was and we were there around 1:00 pm)<br><br>I&#39;d recommend this place to anyone, but I&#39;d definitely mention the price tag. Everything else for our first experience was excellent.
The food here is amazing and so are the drinks! The coconut mojito is my favorite drink and it goes well with the banana cheesecake! Pastas are AMAZING!

No wait and great service. Went with my coworkers and they loved everything. I enjoyed the Brussel sprouts and beet avocado salad. The Ham in the Cuban was a little dry, and that was my only complaint.  Other than that we had a great time and I would definitely recommend this place.
Poor sanitation i.e rust, silverware was dirty and hosts,waiters very talkative to each other. Prices shouldnt be so pricey and they need to decorate all over again.

I tried the Korean fried cauliflower dish and it was one of the worst appetizers I&#39;ve ever tried in me life. You don&#39;t even taste the cauliflower... the whole vegetable is heavily Incased in breaded flour. Had a very awkward sweet taste; I&#39;m presuming there was no limit to the amount of sugar used for this dish. Absolutely horrendous. Shame on whoever created this sad recipe. The attached photo is literally ALL breaded flour ...Very good cheesecakes though.

Of I could give negative stars I would... Customer service here is horrible. Never again.  Was seated and waited 15min as I watcher mutiple servers in my dead-end corner section (Table 65) attend to the other around me, all the while ignoring me completely as they walked by.  Not one person acknowledged my presence, even with multiple servers standing around the POS terminal at the end of the section. It&#39;s not my job to get up and find a server, or is it now self-serve and grab a plate from the window at your leisure.  Spoke to a manager that agreed that the service I received sucked but really the only option he gave was to offer me a server to take my order.  Mostliekly would have to wait forever to get my food.  Told him it wasn&#39;t worth it and walked oit as others walked in.  Not worth the hassle or wait.  A single top can and will sometimes tip better than most 4+ tops... Their loss, not mine.

Recently ordered through the app for pick up and the food was not up to par. The food was cold and the french fries tasted like they were old I also ordered an extra meatball and they forgot it, meatball was also raw. I know times are rough with Covid pandemic but if you&#39;re not going to serve with the same quality then just remain closed.!

Stopped in before a p-bruins game with the fam, it was pretty my damn good. The breakfast burrito was filling and very fresh, the Parmesan crusted chicken was so good but the biggest surprise was the kids cheese pizza was out of this world!  I want to go back and get it for myself.  That good!   Also the waiter was awesome, super friendly and great personality.  Overall a great experience! *obv took the cheesecake to go!*

Came in for take out dessert and the place was rocking as always- hour and half wait in the dining  room and a constant line at the take out counter. The girl working take out tonight 2/17  was the friendliest customer service worker I have come across in a long, long time. She was quick, efficient, and not flustered at all! She was slammed busy and kept a smile on her face the entire time. Extra whip cream? No problem-here&#39;s a container full.. <br>People working in the industry should observe her and take notes.

Who doesn&#39;t like the Cheesecake Factory?! Always delicious with of course many options to chose from! I can never leave without taking a piece of dessert home because they are so delicious and very rich! The potions are large here and will get your money&#39;s worth! Anything you try you will not be disappointed.

Food was mediocre, my chili came out like warm, sent it back, they must have just microwaved it and sent it back out. Service was slow and inattentive. I&#39;ve been here several times before but I will not be returning. This place has changed for the worse. I would have given one star but the lemonade was ok

This last time, we got the factory nachos and the fried cauliflower app.   The latter was amazing.  Crispy and flavorful with two sauces (ranch and BBQ).   I loved the crispy bites in ranch sauce....a really good app....About $6 during the Happy hour special.<br><br>The factory nachos were just OK.   Nice amount of guacamole and cheese, but the taste was a bit weak.  <br><br>Nice helpful staff.   The bar area can get full quickly, so plan ahead.

Horrible service. Save your money and go somewhere you will be respected.  Visited the Providence Rhode Island location for a anniversary. Prior to ordering I made the waitress aware I had a allergy to lettuce and I could not have it on the burger. When they brought my meal out it had extra lettuce and when I made the waitress aware she said it would be a long time before they could fix it and asked if you could bring me a salad. Which I replied if I have a allergy to lettuce how could I eat a salary and she laughed at me and walked away. No worries it only took them over 15 minutes to bring another burger out.

This is one of my top 3 favorite restaurants! I have never ever had a bad meal here and the food always comes out within a timely manner and it&#39;s hot and super flavorful! I have had the chicken costoletta, the honey truffle fries chicken and the filet! All of them where fantastic! I don&#39;t think there is really anything anyone could complain about here! I would highly recommend going here if you haven&#39;t and you won&#39;t be disappointed!

Worst. Service. Ever. While I&#39;m not a fan of turning tables as quickly as possible, they could definitely improve on the 1 hr wait time if they didn&#39;t completely ignore tables for so long. By the time we got seated here, I&#39;d say t took at least 20 minutes for someone just to take our drink orders. And even though we knew what we wanted to eat, she ran away so fast we weren&#39;t able to tell her. <br><br>The food was good. We got the guacamole and chips, I got Romano chicken and by husband got the chicken marsala. Both were good. The cheesecake, as always were delicious. <br><br>My biggest complaint was the service. We waited an hour to be seated, and our whole dinner service took another hour and a half. So it essentially took two and a half hours to eat dinner. I know this wasn&#39;t just us because while we were waiting, we saw plenty of people just sitting there with dirty tables not being cleared. So it seems that it&#39;s either a tactic to order more drinks (which are obnoxiously expensive) or they are just severely understaffed. <br><br>Either way, I don&#39;t know how often I&#39;ll come back, despite the fact that the food is decent. I&#39;m sure I can buy cheesecake to go with a lot less wait time.

Entire meal was terrible ordered shrimp scampi no scampi just fried shrimp didn&#39;t understand that. My husband ordered a chicken dinner the chicken was over cooked and extremely dry never ate it.<br><br>Cost us $100 with tip totally not worth it at all

I keep coming back for their Chocolate Tuxedo Cream Cheesecake!! Take note that there are two entrances to this place, one from the garage parking and one from outside. Oddly they do not have clear signs of this inside the restaurant and I kept using the outside entrance which is inconvenient for handicapped me.

I don&#39;t know why I bothered returning here. Much the less on a Water Fire night. Wait was 20 minutes, NOT bad at all. Waitress was tending to a 6 top with an infant that was just getting their for so it took a bit to initiate our welcome to her section. Drinks took forever and the cheesecake was just alright. Then the bill comes and the drinks were $13 each! Didn&#39;t think they were all that either. Not returning for my own benefit. We could goto Shaw&#39;s, buy a whole cheesecake and a bottle and still have left over. Again nothing too special in the drinks either!!! The other night I ate DINNER at Chili&#39;s with two other people and the bill was $48.

Thanks for ruining my birthday Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Took them over an hour to give us a drink, a salad and an appetizer. None of our food showed up and when our &#34;waitress&#34; served us our salad, she didn&#39;t give us any utensils. After waiting for 20 minutes, we asked another waitress for utensils. As we try to bring this up with our waitress, she gives us an extremely defensive attitude and is not in any sense apologetic. Then we proceeded to sit for another 45 minutes with no food. We asked for a manager who made us pay for what we had eaten instead of comping anything or even a proper apology. Then he proceeded to charge us for the wrong and a more expensive item. <br><br>Just no. Save yourself time and energy and go to the mall food court as we are now forced to be.

Brief Line Up Front: High Calorie endless options with a generically bland taste on entrees that are huge and leave you feeling bloated. If you can make it past the entree, the cheesecakes are pretty good and will put you down for the count.<br><br>Wife and I ate for the first time here for lunch. I ordered a burrito, it tasted ok. It really lacked the savory taste of real Tex-Mex or Latino dishes. It reminded me of eating at my Caucasian friends place and a better version of McCormick&#39;s seasoning... <br><br>My wife got a chicken pasta dish that tasted like a Demi-glaze sauce. This one once again was supposed to be ethnic, like a nice Mediterranean style dish but ended up tasting, institutional...<br><br>Both dishes were absolutely huge. The food was not bad, just not really that flavorful, nothing was over-cooked or under-prepared... service was nice.  <br><br>The red velvet cheesecake my wife went for that we split was great. Next time, skipping the entree, going straight to the cake. This place is perfect for those who do not like spices and like tamed down foods.

Call me totally basic, but I love the Cheesecake Factory! It&#39;s probably my favorite out of the chain restaurants, not only for the fun atmosphere, but also for the extensive and delicious menu offerings! It could take you a lifetime to eat through everything they have here, and that&#39;s kind of awesome. <br><br>I especially enjoy the Skinnylicious Menu, since I have lost 100 lbs in the last year, and it&#39;s wonderful to be able to eat at a favorite restaurant while still staying on track. Members of Weight Watchers, take note! The Tuscan Chicken is a huge and flavorful portion of tender balsamic marinated chicken served with pesto and cherry tomatoes, and only 4 points! The Mexican Chicken Lettuce Wraps are my favorite appetizer, and come brimming with grilled chicken, roasted corn, avocado, and black beans, and are 3 points for the whole dang thing. AND they even have health conscious takes on classic cocktails, like a Cosmo or a Mojito. Where else can you get a Mojito for 4 points? Answer: You can&#39;t. That&#39;s just skimming the surface of some of the amazing things on that Skinnylicious Menu, but it&#39;s absolutely worth checking out because none of the many items sacrifice flavor or quality for healthfulness.<br><br>If you are able to indulge in the full menu, take a gander at the Potato Puffs, which are fried potato balls stuffed with bacon and cheese and served with a tangy ranch dip. That&#39;s the stuff that dreams are made of. They also have a popular Spinach Artichoke Dip, which is one of the best ones available at chain restaurants, served piping hot and gooey with melted cheese. You can easily make a meal out of appetizers here, but if you&#39;re in the mood for an entree, I love the Chicken Picatta, served with a creamy lemon butter sauce (it&#39;s 5% lemon, 95% butter, just as God intended), or the Chicken Parmesan Pizza, which has everything you love about pizza, but instead of the crust, it&#39;s a giant breaded, fried chicken cutlet. So great for Instagram, but remember to bring your selfie light for photos, because it&#39;s dark AF in here.<br><br>Save room for dessert! Of course, you&#39;ll want some cheesecake, like the incredible Mango one that has a coconut macaroon crust instead of the traditional graham cracker, or the Celebration cheesecake that&#39;s like a birthday cake gone wild, with several layers of funfetti cake, and chocolate, vanilla, and strawberry cheesecake. However, don&#39;t overlook the other dessert options, like the Strawberry Shortcake, served with fresh whipped cream and flaky biscuits, or the Chocolate Fudge Cake, which is as decadent as it sounds and perfect for sharing (or not!) The only complaint is that there is a lack of Skinnylicious dessert options. Give me a cheesecake shooter! Give me a mini portion of fudge cake! Something! Anything! PLEASE. <br><br>The Cheesecake Factory is a great place to come with a group, but be prepared to wait if you&#39;re visiting on peak weekend evenings. I love to come here on weeknights, or for a low key lunch before or after shopping at the adjacent Providence Place Mall. Full disclosure: the wait is definitely worth it, though!

Really? Yelping about The Cheesecake Factory? Yeah. I am. What&#39;s. Up. <br><br>Listen. If I&#39;m in any state for a prolonged chunk of time in this country that has a Cheesecake Factory I&#39;m going. <br><br>Why? Uhm because Thai Chicken Wraps don&#39;t just grown on trees and The Cheesecake Factory may have the best ranch dressing. Ever. <br><br>I like a salad that could fit in a wheelbarrow. <br>I appreciate a metal bucket of fries with dressing for dipping served in a gravy boat. <br>I like sodas that are both large and in glass so thick and heavy that I have to use both of my adult hands to pick it up. <br>I like being full.<br>I like the fact that I&#39;ve been going to The Cheesecake Factory since I was a kid and yet have never had a slice of cheesecake there.<br>I like that a restaurant that serves such saucy entrees has their servers wear all white and somehow everyone is clean and crisp and elegant. <br>And well obviously The Reason For Coming:<br>That brown bread y&#39;all. <br><br>I like it all.

Yikes.  The worst experience, apathetic staff, poorly prepared food.  We were the first table sat of the day, today actually.   We were the first table sat at 11:34.  They opened late and kept us and another 4 top waiting outside.  It took 45 minutes for half of the food to arrive, another 15 for the rest to arrive.  We are not talking anything too tricky; A kids chicken skewer, an Asian salad and an omelette coming an hour after ordering.  No apology, just &#34;oh we normally have a hard time opening and there is usually a lot of mistakes in the beginning of the day.&#34;  Huh?  So this is known to the entire staff? <br><br>Salad arrived wilted and soaked in dressing.   Lettuce melted.  Again, we were the first seating of the day.   Daughters omelette arrived an hour after ordering. Missing ingredients.  When we brought it up, our waitress again blamed that kitchen for knowingly sucking.  And of course this absolved her of any responsibility or motivation to help.  It was more like, we are all stuck on this same shitty ride. But yeh, no smile, no how can I make it better, do you want me to get you something else or make it better.  Just an &#34;oh well, sucks for you, this is how it always is&#34; <br><br>Anyway, don&#39;t go here.  It&#39;s terrible and they couldnt care less about you.  I would say it was a fluke experience but, the waitress literally told us, this is how it always is.  If you don&#39;t want to listen to me, I would at least listen to her

Two friends, my lover, and I planned this dinner three weeks prior. We had it set in our synchronized iPhone calendars, and greatly anticipated this meal. No special occasion, just a fun night out with old friends. We were seat at 8:03pm. We ordered a bottle of Veuve Cliquot only to be told (15 minutes later) that they were out of stock. They offered a bottle of Chandon as a substitute which we begrudgingly accepted. We ordered 7 small plates/ appetizers and were more than satisfied with the selection of food. The servers and food runners were not afraid to fat shame us (which we loved). We tried to order a second bottle of our substitute champagne only to be told that our previous bottle was their last. We then switched to cocktails which were mostly sugar water (advertised as fresh ingredients but obviously not) that we sipped through our entrees. The rest of our meal went smoothly and we really had a nice time! <br><br>Write a separate wine list or offer it outside of your main menu in order to keep up with fluctuating supplies! <br><br>Love you!

I love my family and girlfriend for surprising me and taking me here for my birthday but for for gods sake this place is way too hyped up. I waited for two hours because they don&#39;t make reservations???<br>The food isn&#39;t good at all and the portions and horrible. $20 for four pieces of medium sized shrimp and a scoop of angel hair pasta with no season, it was so embarrassing my mother asked the waitress if the was more pasta coming. I was excited because it was my first time going there and I&#39;m more happier to say I will never return.

As a providence native this is the Cheesecake location I have always dined at and have always had positive experiences. Today wasn&#39;t the case. I try to always be very understanding and try to keep in mind we are still facing COVID-19. After I placed my name on the waiting list with the host I sat at an empty seated area until I was notified of an available table. I was NEVER told I couldn&#39;t wait there. After waiting for about 15 minutes the host approaches me and lets me know of other places I can wait at (doesn&#39;t directly tell me I can&#39;t wait at the seated area but i assumed this is what she meant) so I was trying to decide with my fiancé on waiting outside or at the garage ... not even TWO minutes later the manager approaches me and embarrassed me in front of all the other people waiting and let&#39;s me know of their lobby restrictions. I tried to tell her I had already been told and was trying to figure out where to go but she continues to raise her voice and humiliate me! All of the other couples just stared as I was being pointed out the door. Very upsetting as nobody else in the lobby was approached but me. There needs to be better signs or better communication from the host to avoid this mortifying experience.

Went here after a hockey game at the civic center. It seems much smaller than the Hartford branch. The staff was friendly but super focused. Our wait time was 45 minutes. It was spot on. When we were seated a waiter named Shawn came over and introduced himself. We started with basic water/ soda and buffalo bites as an app. <br>These were deep fried wontons filled with buffalo and cheese. The outside was perfectly deep brown and fried. It came with 7 and a side of hot sauce and we chose ranch as a side. Delicious. <br>For entrees I ordered the Louisiana Chicken Pasta. Honestly I haven&#39;t had pasta here that I&#39;ve actually enjoyed.. but this dish.. wow. It was spicy colorful and flavorful. The crispy chicken was perfectly cooked. Tender and juicy and when mixed with the sauce it was perfect. I ordered the carrot cake cheesecake Togo. I was a little disappointed with that.. the other cheesecakes we got seemed to hold their shape.. this one was very crumbly and dry so that was disappointing but overall great visit!

Cheesecake never fails at the Cheesecake Factory (I&#39;ve had many from different bakery&#39;s) i know sometimes it&#39;s hard to pick one out of so many in the menu! Hope you try this one it&#39;s amazing

UPDATE: <br>Had the chance to come back here last night (7/7 around 6pm) after management kindly responded to my last review and sent me a gift card for my meal. My mom wanted to try the impossible burger for the first time and I told her she had to try it here. The hostess with dirty blonde long hair could smile more. We asked to sit outside. Took about 10 minutes but quick seating. Our server was Christopher L. and he was great. Funny, attentive, friendly. Excellent. The food took about 25-30 minutes, not bad at all. It was busy in the restaurant and the food was hot. The impossible burger was no less than perfect! My mom thought it was beef. We all really enjoyed our food. I asked for it with no seasoning this time and it is back to being the best impossible burger in the city. Thanks!!<br><br>OLD REVIEW: <br>Now I&#39;ll start by saying I think cheesecake has the best version of the impossible burger for the buck. It&#39;s $15 with fries, but is absolutely HUGE. I think they put double patty together. Everywhere else the impossible burger is $12-15 but is small, about the size of a BK burger. Here, it&#39;s great. However the last two times I ordered it it was NOT good. They seasoned the burger with SOOO much seasoning I could physically see the seasonings on the patty. It had so much salt I couldn&#39;t even finish it. It was undercooked. It was one of the most horrible things I&#39;ve ever put in my mouth. I knew this was a fluke because I&#39;ve had it here at least 10 times. When I ordered it again a few days ago, I mentioned with the order I didn&#39;t want any additional seasoning and please cook it thoroughly. Again, the burger was loaded with salt. It was cooked this time. But loaded with salt. Very disappointing. This may no longer be my favorite impossible burger spot. Sad because I live right across the street from it.

Not a bad visit at all on a busy day with family. <br><br>Food got to our table quick, drink refills and breads too. Nicely done./ <br><br>happy server and the food was right and looking great. <br><br>TY

Foods great but the restaurant needs to have a separate place for picking up online orders that are already paid for. Waited in line for my already paid order just for the people in front of me to decide what they wanted for cake. Asked the worker if I could just pick up my order that&#39;s already paid for and she said one minute.

Their lettuce wraps never fail to make my stomach smile!! Seriously, can you tell how much I love them?!!<br><br>This location was super busy but that did not stop the staff from providing outstanding service!!

I work in the city so I end up eating here about once a month. I&#39;m not usually a fan of chain type restaurants and don&#39;t really care for places that have super ridiculously large menus, and even though this restaurant fits into these categories, I&#39;ve always received really friendly service and have enjoyed the food here. <br><br>The appetizers, entree salads, and dinner plates like Chicken Madeira and the Factory Meatloaf are my favorites, but I&#39;ve never seen anyone not enjoy what they ordered. Who can resist taking a piece of cheesecake to go? There&#39;s dozens of flavors and varieties to choose from, so pick something that sounds good and enjoy! <br><br>Pro tip:<br>Sit in the bar area between 4:00 - 6:00pm Monday-Thursday and ask for their special bar menu. They serve many of their appetizers and small plates for $5.95 each - which will save you a ton of money and let you sample some things you may not have tried before.

We had our daughter&#39;s birthday there, per her request. Needless to say we will not be going back. <br><br>First, we arrived at 11:00. No parking so I dropped everyone off and went to find parking, which was pretty far away. When I got into the restaurant, my party was still waiting to be seated, in a seemingly not too busy place. <br><br>Anyway, our party of five is seated and it takes our waitress 10 minutes to come over. <br><br>Let me just list all the disappointments. <br><br>-No Water. <br>-One of our party had no silverware. <br>-Took the waitress a long time. <br>-Waitress got my Buffalo Wings wrong, brought me &#34;Buffalo blasters&#34;, the two don&#39;t even sound the same. <br>-Finally our entrees arrive, about 25 minutes after ordering, brought over two plates at a time by one guy.  Meaning three (long) trips to the kitchen. <br>-Waitress forgot the milk for the tea we ordered, then said she&#39;d get it after she took our order. Now tea is cold by the time she comes with the milk. <br>-waitress takes a break, presents new waiter to us. <br>-we tell new waiter we would like some coffee. He forgets. <br>-I get up, because we are halfway through the cheesecake now and still no coffee, and no waiter, and ask three chatting waitresses. One confirms cream and sugar with the coffee, leaves for it and never comes back!<br>-I have to ask for a refill of Coke, comes as we are done eating. <br>-New waiter brings check that was supposed to be split, but old waitress never told new waiter details. Now we have to go through bill with him as to who had what so he can redo it. <br><br>The food was ok, the cheesecake was awesome, but the service was so bad that it ruined our experience. There was plenty of staff, but we were ignored. There is nothing worse than begging for the basics and having to chase down wait staff.

I&#39;ve eaten here several times and never had a bad meal. It&#39;s a little pricey for a chain but I like the food.  We sat in a booth Wednesday night and the lighting was poor. We needed our phone lights to read the menu.  Our server was friendly and competent.  The fresh bread for the table was warm and delicious.  Our entrees were cooked perfect and seasoned well.  My espresso martini was off. Not sure what but not great.  Celebration cheesecake was more cake than cheese.  Bad decision.  <br>Overall an enjoyable evening and we will return.

They need to figure out there customer service/online ordering system. I placed an order for pickup so I wouldn&#39;t have to wait in line, just to be told I had to wait in the long line to pick up an already paid for order. We placed the order online because we had already waited 20 minutes while second in line earlier and the baby was getting restless.
Awesome location! The best waitress ever!!! Super nice and courteous and genuine!! Awesome breakfast waffle and awesome food!! Will definitely come back!!!

We came tonight because we promised our daughter we would. My husband and I had 2 pineapple and ginger martinis....I highly recommend!!! <br><br>4 stars: I ordered the chicken madeira and it was amazing! So tender, flavorful and came with mashed potatoes. My daughter had spicy Jamaica shrimp and chicken that came with white rice, pineapple salsa, black beans and plantains...can I just say...whoa!!! That dish will make you want to rethink your life because it&#39;s sooooo good!!!! My son had a California burrito grande and it was delicious. <br><br>Ugh: my husband ordered the cashew chicken and he was UNABLE to eat it as it was EXTREMELY salty. When the bill came holy crap!!!! The four martinis we had came to over $50!!!! Definitely bot worth the money!!<br><br>When the bill arrived the waitress was kind enough to take the salty cashew chicken off the bill since my husband didn&#39;t eat it so that was a plus. <br><br>Overall, I am a fan of Cheesecake Factory but the menu is OVERWHELMING because it&#39;s so huge, there is usually a wait with no reservations but we were seated quickly tonight at this location, and it&#39;s so expensive and overpriced.... will I visit another Cheesecake Factory again? Ummm....of course I cannot resist!!

Where does your daughter want to go after her college graduation? The Cheesecake Factory!<br><br>We got there shortly after noon. Thankfully, there was no wait.  Our party of 4 ordered drinks and appetizers. The calimari was nice and tender, though I&#39;m used to the garlic oil with banana peppers instead of tartar sauce and cocktail sauce.<br><br>Everyone was happy with their entrees. The menu is huge, so it would be difficult not to find something that you&#39;d like. I went for the Shepard&#39;s Pie, which was quite good. My daughter got the 4 cheese pasta, son got chicken and biscuits, and ex got the  shrimp and chicken gumbo.  Portions were pretty large.<br><br>Nice experience for a chain restaurant.

Awful customer service.  We had a reaervation for.5 people for my daughters birthday.   I called to ask if we could add 2 more people to our group.   I was told no they could only add one.  As if I should leave someone behind. The lack of compassion or courtesy was appalling.    I guess they are so busy they don&#39;t need return customers.

SO SORRY, Cheesecake Factory that I have taken THIS long to write a review! I have been coming here for YEARS and I will continue to be a Loyal, grateful customer. I used to go to the one in Braintree, MA a lot since I lived in Boston at that time. It wouldn&#39;t be as packed as the one in Providence only b/c there were other restaurants around the vicinity. I also noticed that the price of the Well-Mannered Dirty Martini in Braintree is $11 and the one in Providence is $9! Score!... Since I moved back to Providence and it is my favorite &#39;tini!<br><br>I always call ahead to see how long the wait is. It is the only one in Providence so you have to expect a long wait time, especially on the weekends. I love the fact that they&#39;re open late to 12:30AM on weekends! You have to imagine how the hosts &amp; workers feel with hungry, hangry, rude customers complaining about waiting 10-20 minutes. They must be stressed out with all those customers hovering over the hostess stands. Give them a break!<br><br>I LOVE their food. I&#39;ve had almost everything on the menu, no Lie. My favorite though, is Steak Diane (med rare), stuffed mushrooms ( that I cannot find the recipe for), fried zucchini, shrimp scampi, bistro shrimp pasta, tuna tataki salad....Oh man, the list goes on! But FAVORITE FAVORITE is the Steak Diane b/c I always seem to get that. The flavor is sooo delicious and that sauce?! I can&#39;t get enough of it. I dip the steak into it...mix it into my mashed potatoes! I will have to go digging for my old pics to post and it&#39;s going to make me want some more!<br><br>They should open up another location in RI b/c one Cheesecake Factory isn&#39;t enough!

We decided to do something for our 3-year-old and I distinctly asked the waiter (who passed us up at least 30 minutes while going back and forth to other tables) if she could summon the team to do the birthday thing.<br><br>Meanwhile, we both ordered the New York strip. 45 minutes later, we get these two thin slices of steak. Looked like shaved steak on a bone. Days before, we had juicier steaks at Unos. Needless to say, the steaks weren&#39;t flavorful at all. I also ordered homefries and corn. The potatoes were hard and inedible. Tasted like they held them over from breakfast.<br><br>My wife and I ate around the nastiest lunch ever and finished our lunch date elsewhere. We left av15% tip for the waitress who couldn&#39;t care less about refilling the water or calling the manager.<br><br>In the end, the waitress nudges me to tell me she &#34;has something coming for the birthday girl.&#34; To our surprise, it was the one waitress singing happy birthday solo. Interesting, since the entire team sang it three times BEFORE our table. Cheesecake NASTory is losing.
I wasn&#39;t wowed when I tried the food or cheesecake. Don&#39;t get me wrong it did taste good but for me I could of got something else better for the price.

I was severely disappointed going to this place TWICE. Now I will say I&#39;ve gone before years and years ago and I loved it so I expected it to be just as good. I was wrong. My second visit was horrible. We had a reservation but had to wait a while anyway. The service was horrible. It took FOREVER to get drinks. We were sat at this TINY table squished in between two other couples. Way too close for comfort. The food literally tasted like Olive Garden which in my opinion is like the McDonald&#39;s of Italian food. <br>The third time I went we decided to sit at the bar figuring we&#39;d at least get our drinks on time. That was kind of true. Even though we were sat there the bartenders seemed to mostly be paying attention to getting drinks out to the tables! Which I thought was incredibly ironic. I got a burger this time as I already knew their pasta was garbage. That being said, so was their burger. I just can&#39;t win with this place. If I ever have to go again I&#39;m getting the Thai lettuce wraps and calling it a day.

Favorite restaurant in the world! They have one of the most expansive menus filled with amazing appetizers, entrees, and desserts! There&#39;s food for all dietary needs, and it&#39;s all absolutely delicious!!!

So we struck out at a restaurant we wanted to try and we ended up here at the cheese cake factory.<br>It was close by to the other restaurant and with the rain coming in it was a good idea to park in the PP mall garage so we wouldn&#39;t have to fight the rain afterwards.<br>It was around 3:30 on a Sunday and there was only 2 parties waiting on a table in front of me and the hostess was nowhere in sight.<br>So the hostess shows up after a few minutes and by this thine there was a few parties that showed up after me and I&#39;m standing at the hostess station waiting for service.<br>I gave her my name and she said 5 to 10 minutes and I moved up the steps to be out of the way.<br>Mean while here comes a steady flow of customer.<br>As I was waiting I noticed they was calling names of parties which where people that was behind me on the wait list.<br>So after they cleared the crowd I&#39;m wondering why wasn&#39;t I called yet so I went back up to the hostess station and again no one was there <br>After 5 minutes the manager came by to check on hostess and noticed she&#39;s not around and asked me if I needed help and I said yes I want to know why all the others that came in after me had already been seated and I&#39;m still standing around.<br>So he asked me if I&#39;ve put my name in and I said yes before all the others did.<br>So he looked and he said my name was not on the wait list. I almost lost my shit on him and the hostess shows up and he asked her if she had entered my name and she did not recall. I&#39;m not someone you forget in less than an hour.<br>So I had to remind her on our exchange and then she recalled so the manager now finds my name on the system and said my name was put on hold.<br>So I replied I couldn&#39;t have done it.<br>I was standing up on til of the stairs as the hostess kept walking by with all the other people that came in after me.<br>So the hostess said she didn&#39;t do it so I guess it was my fault my name was put on hold in their computer system.<br>Which I still think the manager should have compensated me somehow for that grief.<br>Anyway we get our table and now I&#39;m upset over this incident.<br>Our waiter swings by the table and introduced himself as Jay B.<br>and started the drink order and once he can back with our drinks he mentioned the specials that was being offered for the day.<br>We placed a app order of the factory nachos with the spicy chicken to start.<br>Our waiter Jay inquired on the availability of the tuna which we&#39;ve tried to order the last few visits and it&#39;s never available but they keep flashing the images of the seared tuna behind the cheese cake counter.<br>Anyway it was no surprise it was again not available.<br>So my wife ended up with the Asian lettuce wrap tacos and the soup special which was a cream of chicken with artichoke hearts and I opted for the shrimp scampi, the little one got Mac and cheese.<br>So Jay brings us the nachos as he keeps us informed on the status of the the rest of the dishes and showed a great sense of awareness.<br>And I also noticed along with my wife on what a outstanding waiter he was.<br>To the point where he did not belong there.<br>He should be at a 5 star restaurant with his 5 star service he was providing.<br>He was on top of his game and had the best personality to boot <br> Have to said that the cheese cake is probably the only chain restaurant I would dine multiple times at only because they&#39;re very consistent on the quality and recipes.<br>And this waiter was for sure the highlight and saving grace after the waiting for the table debacle.<br>I almost had to go thank the hostess for screwing up and made me wait longer for my table which in turn put us at Jay&#39;s table.<br>So here&#39;s the break down.<br>Food is good enough for 3.5 stars<br>Waiter&#39;s service is 5 plus stars

We were told a 30 min wait only to be 45 mins then more waiting on the 2nd level. Someone buy these folks a clock.<br><br>Update : it was another 30 mins waiting on the stairs for a table so maybe they need glasses too.

Last night my fiance, step-son and I went to dinner at Cheesecake Factory, someplace we have had dinner numerous times before.  However, last night was HORRENDOUS! We waited a half hour to be seated, which is normal for this location.  When we sat, our waiter came over to introduce himself and then shortly after we had another waitress.  We had ordered the Korean Cauliflower for an appetizer, but the majority of it was overcooked.  We then waited forever for refills on our drinks, more bread and our dinners.  My fiance ate half of his entree, when he noticed that a portion was completely uncooked.  We waited about 20 minutes for our waiter or waitress to come back... finally, we saw the manager.  We showed her the under cooked chicken.  She agreed it should never have come back to the table and took the plate back to the kitchen to speak to them.  She never came back to the table to talk to us, which we felt was rude. The waiter was not notified of the raw chicken until we told him.  He went back to check on what was going on and told us that he was removing it from the bill.  We paid and left.  However, we both feel that serving someone raw chicken, where they could get food poisoning - deserved more of a compensation and more of an apology than what we received.  We will not return to this location after tonight as we do not feel how the situation was handled was right.  Our waiter that rang us out was Jay B.

AMAZING food, artistic atmosphere. Inspired me to create a surreal piece.... first of many. Sculpture comprised of bread, french fry, toothpick, drink, and tied by mouth cherry stem. Cannot wait to return here for my next masterpiece!
The menu as many people say is huge, but never had issues with my food. I always get the chipotle chicken pasta.

Cheesecake Factory is still one of my fave places to eat. I usually frequent the same plates: the firecracker salmon app, avocado eggroll app, crab cake bites app, factory meatloaf, goat cheese &amp; beet salad &amp; the Asian ck lettuce wraps. All of these plates are excellent w/quality ingredients &amp; flavored well. Portions are usually large so I never quite make it to dessert. I&#39;ve tried the s&#39;mores cheesecake &amp; Oreo cheesecake for the first time &amp; those are winners! Hubby loves the ck &amp; waffles only available for brunch on weekends.

So I really liked this place in 2007, but over the last decade plus, it has gotten worse and worse. Let&#39;s start with the ridiculously long line and no reservation policy. Why is that?!? If I have a large party it would take forever to get in!<br><br>Staff: average, will get you refills if you ask even though they are supposed to attend to you. The speed at which they serve is slow and can be even more frustrating when there are so many people<br><br>Food: the chicken Caesar salad which was my favorite is now not my favorite; because it has become bad and both the quality and quantity had deteriorated over the last decade. The other dishes I got were too salty and sometimes even though it is supposed to be a dish served hot, it felt warm, which makes me think it was prepared in a timely manner but served in an untimely manner.<br><br>Bathroom: a bit on the unclean side because of the large amount of population that passed through it, no pun intended.

My friend &amp; I went here for lunch just today , our server took forever to grab our drinks , appetizers and entrees . We both got sick after eating here !! I&#39;m very mad we just threw up 100$ worth of food and didn&#39;t even get great service and now both are sick!!! Very mad and gassy will not be coming back !!!

So what can you say about the Cheesecake Factory? Well consistency comes to mind, what you order is what you get. I loveeee their most popular dish chicken medeira and my hubby got the bbq chic salad which is so good. Thank you CC factory for always being on point with our favorite dishes :)

What&#39;s there to say about the Cheesecake Factory . Yes, it&#39;s a chain restaurant. Yes, it&#39;s very good food. No complaints in that department. I had the Chicken Madeira and my husband had the Fish Tacos. Both meals were delicious in their own way. Our server Henry was great! Only complaint was the wait time. We waited about 40 mins. Make sure to go early.

Service was slow but our waiter was very nice. Our appetizers and bread came late and our entrees came just as late. We only got one round of bread and usually the bread comes first, it didn&#39;t. One of us had a curfew and dropped her off an hour late due to how slow the service was... <br><br>The food and drinks were great though. But everything is rather overpriced, only went here due to having a gift card. Wouldn&#39;t normally eat here.

I&#39;ve been coming to this location for over 20 years and its always been great for the most part. We went on a recent Friday night at 5:45pm. I asked for a booth, and was told it would be about a 30 minute wait. We actually waited 40 minutes, but by the time we were seated the foyer had become mobbed and the wait time for a party of 2-4 had become 90 minutes! In addition to no where to stand and wall to wall people, its extremely loud inside the entire restaurant.<br><br>Our server was decent. The menu is A la Carte but extensive. You can get burgers, tacos, pasta, pizza, Asian, or American type food. I got the Chicken Teriyaki with rice and plantains. Very well prepared and decent portions and tasted great. My partner had gotten Evelyn&#39;s pasta and it too was prepared well. We shared a tossed salad, each had a soda, and for dessert we each took home a piece of cheesecake. I chose the key lime and they had a the chocolate cheesecake.<br><br>The bill with entrees, sodas, salad, cheesecake, tax and tip came to 85.00. I thought it was a little pricey, and noticed the size of the cheesecake slices could have been a little larger, but aside from the crowded chaos in the waiting area, I would recommend coming here.

What I love most about this place is there huge dessert menu! If for some reason you are not in the mood for cheesecake?!? They have so many options like this apple crisp! <br><br>I gave a 3 star review because it&#39;s one of the better chain restaurants and the menu has a large variety which is great especially if your with a big party. I just wish this wasn&#39;t the only Cheesecake Factory in RI and it was somewhere else other than Providence Place Mall.

Today was my third and final visit to this location.  We absolutely love The Cheesecake Factory chain.  However, this location is not properly managed, and it shows.  We went there for a late lunch today. I ordered an appetizer, my husband ordered and entree and we ordered 2 kids meals.  They brought out the appetizer and the entree at the same time before the kids meals.  It took 35 minutes for this to happen.  Then, the waitress came out a few minutes later with my 2 year olds pizza and just the fries from my 5 years olds chicken and fries (in a cup!, no plate!!) meal.  <br><br>Then my husband cut into his steak that was ordered &#34;medium well&#34;.  It was rare. I asked the waitress what temp she put in the order for, and she said &#34;medium, because she was afraid the kitchen would overcook it&#34;.  The waitress finally came with the chicken fingers after my child had inhaled all of the fries, and he barely touched his chicken. :-/ The steak came back out, 1/2 still rare and 1/2 well done. The waitress didn&#39;t come back to check on if the situation had been fixed.  When I brought it to her attention that it was still rare/not edible for us she asked to take it back again. I declined as my kids were now restless at this point. We order dessert to go. She took 20 minutes to pick up and process the check. She didn&#39;t take off the steak, nor did she send over a manager. IMO, if a kitchen fails to cook a dish twice, that warrants a visit from a manager. <br><br>We will never go back to this location.

Although it is a chain restaurant I have really never had a bad experience here. The serves are always so nice, and the food is pretty good! Comes out slow on busy nights beware. The vegan Cobb salad is actually delicious. And all their dressings are incredible. My boyfriend got the orange chicken and he enjoyed it. He reheated it the next day and didn&#39;t enjoy it he said. Despite the huge portions, not all things are good leftover here! I really do enjoy the food here. But come hungry!

It&#39;s Friday night and it took us 50 minutes to be seated and order. Had a cocktail while we waited and it was $15! It was another 45 mins to get our food which was one omelet and one burger. My omelet was great but served on a burning hot plate and I wasn&#39;t told to be careful so I grabbed it to help the server! Not good!  Burger was good but a little over cooked. We were never offered beverages other than water. Wait staff never came back to check on us. We had to flag them down every time! It was very noisy too so we couldn&#39;t have a conversation between us and we were right next to each other. Definitely not a place we will go back to.

The Cheesecake Factory is consistently amazing excellent place to eat whether you&#39;re talking about the quality of the food or the employees. My most recent experience however was less than satisfactory. After being told to expect an hour wait I was asked to wait 30 minutes then come back for a pager. I came in at 7pm and was handed a pager and told it would be an additional 20-30 minute wait. I found a place to stand and waited. 40 minutes went by and I decided to ask for an update. At that point I was told my party had already been called. My pager never went off and my party was never called. Not only did they skip us but they also insulted my intelligence. I still would recommend the Cheesecake Factory overall I just didn&#39;t appreciate that had I not gone up to ask they would have allowed me to stand there and wait until they closed.

We skipped lunch, rolled in at about 4:15 on a Saturday. We were still somehow given a 15 minute wait. When we arrived at our table, most two tops around us were empty. A bus boy (who was super nice) came by and told us our waitress had to move her car, so we waited for quite a while for our food order. The food was very average. The experience is honestly ruined by the calorie noted for each dish. How can I enjoy a burger when I&#39;m told it&#39;s 1800 calories? Why does this make any sense? Things just felt odd when leafing through a 20 page menu, only to find that most items were around 1500-2000 calories. We had at least three different waiters who all introduced themselves and explained there was a shift change. I&#39;m writing this review the morning after, and I still feel unsettled by the food we ate.

Came in for brunch on the weekend. Our server was pretty nice and came to check on us often, but even though there was barely anyone in the restaurant, our food took forever to come out. I got the fried chicken and waffles eggs benedict, which was good but not exceptional- I don&#39;t know if it was worth the price. Otherwise, it was a good meal.

What an amazing experience we had at the Cheesecake Factory today!  We went for a tour (For our students who are learning about work experiences) and the Manager Jay was fantastic!  He and his Executive Kitchen Manager Shawn gave our group such a fantastic tour!  We all learned so much and we even stayed for the most amazing, fantastic lunch ever!  Our waitress Tara was above and beyond fantastic and the food was simply perfect.  Thank you Cheesecake Factory, for an experience we will not forget!
Years ago I went to the one in sawgrass mills Florida and was disappointed. I&#39;m so glad I gave them another chance because this location blew my mind . Everything tasted delicious!

I ordered the shrimp and herb crusted salmon through door dash and the shrimp was cold,  strike one. The salmon was room temperature, strike two. The tiramisu cake was an epic fail, I was disappointed because tiramisu is my favorite dessert. The food quality at at Cheesecake Factory is not as good as it used to be. I will pass on eating here again, don&#39;t waste your money.

Me and my parents were looking for a good restaurant to stuff our faces at, and it hit us, we wanted to go to The Cheesecake Factory! We never went to this place, but we heard free bread and butter was being served there. I tasted the bread. It was amazing! Crunchy, sweet, and fresh! My party of 3 ordered three more plates of bread! After that, I ordered a steak. Even though the restaurant was extremely busy, the food came no longer than 25 minutes! I love this place and would love to come again!

Came back after Philharmonic for dessert...my friends ordered strawberry shortcake, and celebration cheesecake. I decided to order avocado toast, b/c I hadn&#39;t time to order it as an app before dinner. My friends loved their desserts, they looked good and portions were large. The avocado toast was incredible. Really crusty rustic  toast, mashed avocados, chopped cherry  tomatoes, arrugula leaves, and radish slices.
Really good, they&#39;re always consistent and have great service. Even if you go less than an hour before closing they show great effort with the food and with the service.

Ugh. Why do I still keep coming back here? I wish I could give a better review but after years of coming here I just don&#39;t appreciate the food. The menu is the same as it&#39;s always been with the occasional new update. The portions are absolutely absurd and overwhelming. The bread is delicious and the cheesecake, if you have room, is quite delicious but very heavy. They changed there chicken salad and this is what killed it for me- it was very watery and hard large chunks. Not edible past a few bites. The service was extremely slow and irritating.

My boyfriend and I knew that the restaurant gets super packed during dinner hours so we decided to play some quick games at the Dave &amp; Buster&#39;s nearby and then stop in for dinner at around 10:45-11:00 PM. And just like we thought, the place died down a bit that evening and we didn&#39;t have to wait for a table. <br><br>We were assigned a nice waitress but the service wasn&#39;t great at all. Asked for some extra napkins for a water spill on the table but never got them, our meal didn&#39;t arrive until well past an 1.5 hours later, our waters didn&#39;t get refilled until AFTER we finished eating, and we still had to wait a good some time after we finished eating, got the check, and paid for it. <br><br>I can expect this kind of service during super busy hours but I was hoping to NOT since there weren&#39;t that many people there that night. <br><br>I would have given the place a lower rating if it weren&#39;t for their Oreo cheesecake, perhaps the only thing going for the restaurant (I would hope). <br><br>Too long, didn&#39;t read: this restaurant is super hyped so it&#39;s not worth stopping in. You&#39;re also paying a bit more than average for an average meal but what can you expect from a chain?

Do not come here unless you want to pay for EXTREMELY overpriced mediocre (at best) food. My daughter got the chicken alfredo - $25 for pasta and chicken? The drink menu did not have prices on them otherwise i would not have paid $13 for a watered down juice drink that they say was a cocktail.  2 sips is all i got from this drink because there was so much ice in it.  As soon as we walked in, we should have walked right back out - the girl at the front desk gave me the dirtiest look for no reason. I got the chicken reisling - the pasta was clumped together and a portion of it was hard.  If a cook can&#39;t cook something as simple as pasta, he should not work in a restaurant.  This was my first time going here and will be my last. I don&#39;t mind paying extra for good food....but i could have cooked better food than this at home.

I have heard many faves about The Cheesecake Factory.  I was looking forward to this first encounter.  I admit that I was let down.  It is rather easy for me to summarize the impression I have of The Cheesecake Factory in Providence.<br><br>Pro:<br>Nice decoration<br>Professional and friendly wait staff<br>Large portion<br>Reasonable price as per portion and decor<br>Fresh ingredients<br>Delicious cheesecake<br><br>Con:<br>Cutting corners/steps in cooking<br><br>The BBQ Pork Sandwich was noted in menu as using pulled pork.  The product contained chunks of pork, none pulled into stripes.  The flavour didn&#39;t infused inside the pork chunks.  This shortcoming would not have been noticeable should someone have pulled the pork into stripes.  Having said that, the burger was delicious (thumb up to the sauce) if this was a BBQ Pork Chunk Sandwich.  My suggestion is to either pull the pork as described in the menu description, or change the menu description into &#34;chunks of pork&#34;. <br><br>I never expected fish tacos to be authentic in Rhode Island.  What I expected was something that looked like fish tacos and tasted good.  The fish tacos looked okay and came in double corn tortillas.  The white fish strips were chunky and fresh enough.  Unfortunately, the double corn tortillas were completely cold and half stiff.  This indicated that they were not kept warm and moist, or at least not re-hydrated and warmed up before use.  The best way I can describe how unenjoyable these tacos were is to imagine someone serves a hamburger in cold and half hardened buns.  <br><br>The accompanied bean and rice were not refried beans and Mexican rice, yet both tasted alright.

This is a nice restaurant for small groups of friends or families or colleages to hang out for a dine or drink. Its cakes line up a variety of selects and some of the are very popular, which means your favourite one may be out of stock when you are ready to have some deserts.

This place is reliable-you will wait for a bit on a weekend nite and then you will enjoy some decent food. The menu is ridiculously long but the food is good. More vegan options would be nice (why not a tofu option for many of the chicken dishes for example). Overall we enjoy coming here and the cheesecake is divine. All locations look similar so you know wha to expect.

went today with a party of 2. our waitress was amazing and very friendly. my bacon bacon burger was amazing and my cousins pizza looked delicious! we also got a  Godiva brownie sundae which is to DIE FOR. overall i enjoyed my experience and will definitely be returning.

We drove all the way from Nebraska to go to this place, my nephew lives there. I&#39;ve wanted to go here ever since I learned that Penny from Omaha works for these guys.<br>It was about a month ago and I don&#39;t remember exactly what we got but it was great. Our waitress was the best, very friendly and helpful. The food was great. Sorry I can&#39;t remember more details, but if I was in the area again I would definitely go again. Very nice experience.

Had a great meal tonight! Arrived at 6 pm on Saturday night with a party of five. Told it was an hour and 15 minutes to an hour and 20 minutes, which was expected. They called us for our table in about 50 minutes. Our server was excellent! Unfortunately, didn&#39;t get his name. He was friendly, efficient and attentive even though it was crazy busy. Food was SO yummy! Be aware the jambalaya is VERY spicy! Cheesecake was outstanding! Overall a fantastic night!

Came here on a Sunday night on the last night of PVD Fest after work with my coworker, her boyfriend, and a close friend/coworker. Waitress informed us that they were out of steaks and burgers. We took awhile to order everything -- mainly because we were all pretty indecisive, so I&#39;m glad she was patient with us. For appetizers we had the mac and cheese bites and the stuffed mushrooms. Both tasted heavenly and mouth watering. For my entree I ordered the Chicken Madeira, which was two sautéed chicken breasts, mushrooms mashed potatoes asparagus and cheese, all my favorite ingredients. The dish was smeared with mushroom sauce and was a HUGE portion that I almost didn&#39;t finish! (But I did, because I was starving.) We finished off the meal with a chocolate mousse cheesecake slice, which we had to take home because everyone was so full. Overall, great meal, and great service as well.

We went there for lunch today. Luckily didn&#39;t wait too long to be seated. The miso salmon and chicken gumbo were good. However, the steak was over-done and dry, although my husband specially confirmed when placing his order. The soup of the day was too salty, especially when they didn&#39;t refill the bread basket. The greens in house salad were not fresh either. More disappointing is the service: had to ask for steak knife, no replacement of dirty forks &amp; knives, long time for refilling water, no refilled bread basket. At the end, another server simply took our plates instead of boxing them up... The positive side is the cheesecakes keep their high quality.

Because it&#39;s a bit pricey, I used to go here as my birthday dinner every year as a treat.  This last time I went, they had taken my very favorite meal off of the menu (stuffed chicken tacos with that lovely melty spoon cornbread) and ALSO my favorite cheesecake (caramel apple) !  What I ordered was ok, it just wasn&#39;t what I wanted.  My two favorite things that I ordered over and over and .... gone !  The food is still good, it&#39;s just with the wait that always comes with this location, the noise level of this restaurant, and now the menu changes, I can&#39;t see myself returning.  Birthday disappointment.

The service was great.  Waitress was fast, accurate, and friendly.  Unfortunately all the food was subpar at best.  Huge portions of bland way over priced food.  <br><br>Personally I will never go back again. Gave it two stars for friendly staff, and good clean dining area.

In terms of the taste of the food this place is awesome. However having been there more than once, it is annoying that the food is not always available and they always not tell you from the beginning. I understand that there are food menu is huge and they&#39;re not available to tell me all the plates that are not available but when I go there only for the avocado rolls and they don&#39;t have the avocado rolls and you don&#39;t know until you ask the server for them it is pretty annoying.Other than that their service is great.

After a long night of trekking through the wilderness and braving the dark skies, I arrived in Providence and I was dying of hunger. The beautiful love in my life suggested we go here, and as it just so happened, we were standing outside the doors when it opened up at 10 am. What a coinkydink! Although I was hungry, I was more interested in spending every waking moment with her than eating. Not seeing her after so many months was hard and I was happy I was there at the cheesecake factory in that moment with her by my side. <br><br>She ordered a &#34;fufu&#34; drink which was thier passion fruit mojitos. She calls it &#34;fru fru&#34; but thats weird, its &#34;fufu&#34;. I decided to have one as well.  It was sweeter than I am used to but then again nothing was sweeter than sitting with this breathtaking woman in this restaurant. <br><br>I ordered a Spinach mushroom bacon and cheese omelet with potatoes and toast. My lovely lady ordered a California omelet with potatoes and a bagel. Although I was looking for an omelet with snausage (can&#39;t find breakfast snausage on the entire menu) the bacon worked out just fine. There was nothing spectacular about the meal; however, the company I was with was EXCEPTIONAL and for that Providence Cheesecake Factory I give you 5 stars.

Came in to eat at 5pm on Saturday night with my husband, and was lucky enough to grab 2 seats at the bar and avoid the 45 min wait. From the moment we sat down til we finished eating, the 2 male bartenders took exceptional care of us. Very impressive on a busy night. They both were attentive to us and the other customers at the bar and never missed a beat. Our cucumber martinis were delicious (highly recommend) to our appetizer of dynamite shrimp and entrees of a ribeye steak cooked perfectly and my steak Diane that is to die for. Cant say how satisfied we both were. The best part was the bartenders seemed happy and genuinely liked their job, and was able to keep up with drinks for the entire restaurant and give 5+ for service.
Went to lunch this afternoon and was taken care of by Kimberly and she was so sweet!!! Great service!
Another Cheesecake Factory. It is everything you would expect. It&#39;s a big, decorated well, staff is nice and the food is pretty good. Not bad

Warning: do not visit here. If you do, it&#39;s buyer beware. Long wait times and questionable food safety. <br><br>Waited 90 minutes for seating after being told 45 minutes was the wait by the hostess. Warning, there is very limited indoor / outdoor seating. <br><br>Waited 10 minutes after seating for our drinks. <br><br>Waited another 70 minutes for food to arrive. <br><br>Yes, we made a poor decision waiting that long. <br><br>Then the worst started. <br><br>One meal of chicken Parmesan pizza had several hairs in it. <br><br>Another meal of chicken Parmesan pizza had pieces of plastic the size of a fingernail. Waitress stated that &#34;sometimes the kitchen just rips off the plastic on the frozen chicken and accidentally cook plastic into the food&#34;. <br><br>After getting the bill, the waitress accidentally stepped on one of the children&#39;s feet (2 year old that just learned to walk). To be fair, little one was standing close by her side next to the table. <br><br>We had our meals comped. The Cheesecake Factory here is really far below standards. Our regular Cheesecake Factory in Texas never treats us that way in all our years of visiting.

Decided to go to the world famous Cheesecake Factory for my Sister in laws Birthday. Got there and they said 45 minute wait which I thought wasnt bad considering it was Sat night downtown. As we waited about 50 min and asked where we stood on &#34;The list&#34; we were told half hour which was basically what they originally told us. After some family members went to the mall and a hour and 57 min passed I went back up to the hostess told her how long we have been waiting and miraculously we were next (LoL). <br>  We get seated and get drinks ordered we asked for bread because A. We were starving and B. Who doesnt want bread? Time went by no bread got our drinks no bread other tables getting bread. We ask again waitress said they were out of bread for a little bit as I see every table with bread. So we all order and waited very long time for the food. When the food arrived orders were wrong things missing things cooked wrong no sauce on pasta I ask food runner for mustard I mine as well asked Helen Keller all i got was a nod no words and i never got the mustard. We all start eating but at this point the pregnant Birthday girl has sent her food back twice. Situation was so bad that we didnt even complain and the manager still came over to apologize and help. <br>  But hey we are at cheesecake factory so what can help a horrible dinner than a nice world renowned slice of cheesecake? We ask for it to go since no joke it was over 4 hours we have been there...4 hours half a shift?? So we pay for our over priced food and leave I get home and my cheesecake had a thumb print dent and was flipped over destroyed.... Fail.. I will probably never go back...I gave 3 stars due to the manager doing a great job and the food that wasnt messed up was great.. Cheesecake Factory? More like Cheedecake Factory of Terror

Only con with this place is usually the wait, if you don&#39;t make a reservation expect atleast a 15 minute wait. Other than that, love the food. My go to is the Factory Peach Bellini drink, The Pasta Napolitano and their Dulce De Leche Cheesecake. Amazing!

It breaks my heart to give such a bad review to a restaurant I love but here is why...<br><br>Saturday night, around 6pm, we are given an hour wait time. No big deal. We expected that so we killed an hour outside talking. When we finally get to our table, the girl waiting on us was very sweet. She was filling in for our server, Grace, who was on break. We ordered waters and then about 15 minutes later, our meals. He went with a bacon bacon burger with sweet potato fries. I ordered Parmesan herd crusted chicken with red skin garlic mashed potatoes and green beans. <br><br>Our food took a normal amount of time for a busy Saturday night. Our food was exactly how we ordered it. I only ate one of the 3 pieces of chicken and a few bites of the mashed and also green beans. It was amazing but I just couldn&#39;t even dent it. Our server Grace was back at this time. She took my food to wrap it up and we ordered a huge piece of chocolate cake to split. It was delicious. <br><br>She brought my food back and also our bill. It was only about $50 for the both of us and he put his card in with the check. Our server ran the wrong check with his card despite giving us the proper check in the first place. She charged his card $130 for the table across from us. This wasn&#39;t a huge deal. Just a pain and a stupid mistake. <br><br>We fixed that and left. Later that evening when I got hope, I opened up my left overs thinking I&#39;d have some more chicken but nope! The girl sent me home with the wrong left overs. So gross. Someone&#39;s half chewed asparagus was in the place of delicious meal. This was such a let down. I had 75% of my meal left. That&#39;s the main reason I am doing. This mediocre review. I thought of calling the restaurant and complaining but it was just a mistake. <br><br>I&#39;ll go back again and hopefully have a better experience so I can update this review.

First off the service was really great!   The food was tasty and plentiful.  I really enjoyed the egg roll sampler but best if shared between two people to get the best tasty experience.  The Chicken Costolletto was delicious but needed more sauce.   The mash potatoes were like warm and needed to be hotter.  Overall a good meal.

I love the food here but they took the firecracker salmon rolls off the menu for no reason and the Thai peanut pasta dish even though there is other dishes with nuts on the menu. I hope they can bring these two dishes back and if they do next time my rating will be higher.

Called and told they don&#39;t accept reservations. Once we arrived, said it was 40 minute wait and we agreed to wait. Fifty two minutes went by and decided to ask what was going on. Hostess stated no one wanted to clear tables or do dishes so it would be another 40 minutes till a table was cleaned. Not sure if it&#39;s the lack of Rhode Island customer service or just plain college students not wanting to work, but last time I checked a table for 6 would leave a good tip than a table for 2 (which is what they were seating). I&#39;ve been to various Cheesecake Factories and this is the worst one yet. If you expect prompt seating and excellent customer service, stay away from this place.

I have a problem with the Cheesecake Factory.  Don&#39;t get me wrong their meals are large and tasty.  Their salads are deceivingly unhealthy - loaded with carbs, calories and sugars.  I ate a 2300 calorie salad.  <br>Their menu is scattered and confusing.  It&#39;s large and overwhelming.  It seems like I always need some time to process the massive project.  <br>After a carb loaded menu - you can experience one of their delicious specialties - called cheesecake.  They are known for their lengthy wait times.  The Cheesecake Factory is fine - I&#39;ll avoid when I feel the need for portion control.

Went for breakfast on Sunday morning 10/27/19 and had a wonderful waitress name Chaneda. Breakfast was delicious.. fresh squeezed OJ, real maple syrup and lemon ricotta pancakes !  I also tried the breakfast tacos! YUMMY perfection!The only reason I give 4 stars is because I asked the hostess if I could move my seat closer to the bathroom and she told me I couldn&#39;t, then I asked for a sling to place my baby carrier in and she told me I could put the baby carrier in the booth

I don&#39;t know why I keep coming back really.<br><br>Sometimes we come here for last minute convenience. This is not the same standard they held themselves to say 10 years ago, and I just can&#39;t justify the visits anymore really.<br><br>My go to item was always the chicken cobb salad. Most recently, the chicken on it wasn&#39;t the same as it used to be and was just ok. They actually removed my hunny&#39;s go to item (Kobe beef burger) from the menu. <br><br>On the visits over the past year, we have tried the salmon, burgers, pasta, and salads. All were somewhat below average and not as great as we remember. Service has somewhat become hit or miss too. <br><br>Cheesecake never fails here though.
Food is always great at CF, today I took a group of 12 people and everyone 100% satisfied with the food and service! The only negative was the wait.

Food was good, menu was huge and the service was descent.  I only WISH they did not print the calories on the menu!!  It certainly makes you really think twice about dining out and it almost makes you feel guilty.  lol  Anyhow... The Chicken Madeira was really good with lots of flavor as was the Bang-Bang Chicken &amp; Shrimp.  The Cheesecake was good, but all in all, I still think I prefer Junior&#39;s Cheesecakes.

If you have ever had the Cheesecake Factory before, you will feel at home. Consistent food which is expected at a chain of this size. That being said, the experience is made much better by some pleasant and very attendant staff. The wait to get a table can be long since it is attached to the mall and within walking distance of many of the downtown attractions.

I have to say I am not big on chain restaurants so I wasn&#39;t expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. <br><br>The food was great, fried mac and cheese and pan seared artichoke was excellent and of course the cheesecake was to die for! Our waitress was also one of the most attentive, pleasant servers I have ever had which really made it such a great experience. I will definitely be back!
So much to choose from try to stay in the low calorie low fat dishes but I always like that was fear the bread the people in the many many choices I like Cheesecake Factory

The location of this Cheesecake Factory is a little odd because it is kind of attached to the mall but you have to walk outside to get to it. They also don&#39;t validate mall parking. The food is the same as usual. The wait was a little long.  We were seated near the kitchen area and we could actually hear the chef yelling at the people working in the kitchen, which was a little strange. The worst part was the service inside. We waited 30 minutes for appetizers and then another 45 min for our food. Our waiter actually disappeared and we had to flag down other waiters for updates. One waiter  told me he couldn&#39;t even find our waiter! I&#39;m not sure if he was hiding from us but he was not apologetic about the long wait. He just told us they &#34;were slammed&#34;, as if that somehow made it okay. The food itself was good but I deducted a star for how long I had to starve waiting for my food.

Came here on a Saturday night with my boyfriend and my goodness it was super packed! For just us two it was a 45 min to an hr wait! I&#39;m assuming it must be busy due to the WaterFire event they got going on that night. We were starving and really wanted to try the place out so we decided to wait. One hr later we finally got called in and you already know what I ordered first... the drinks! Drinks were a bit pricey but packed a punch. The Tex Mex Eggrolls really saved the day because if it didn&#39;t taste so bomb I would still be pissed for having to wait this long for food! Entrees were okay. It wasn&#39;t the best but it wasn&#39;t bad either. It really filled me up with their huge portions. Overall I would only come here next time if I were to be in town randomly on a weekday and starving to death for those Eggrolls.

Ordered a rib eye steak which was good, but mashed potatoes were a horror show. All glued together and hard. I could lift them as a monolith with my fork. No way these were fresh. I told the waitress Who offered a fresh serving but by this time the rest of my meal was finished. The waitress brought over the manager and said mashed potatoes were so important that they make them every two hours. Lied to my face and offered me nothing. That was my Father&#39;s Day dinner. We won&#39;t be returning.

Cheesecake Factory is the best! Everything on the menu is delicious. The menu is more like a novel; so many options from drinks to entrees and appetizers and of course, dessert! Any time is the perfect time for this restaurant. Just this year alone, I went for my birthday, New Year&#39;s Eve, and to celebrate my first year in college. <br><br>My favorite items here are the orange chicken with white rice plate, the tropical iced tea, the Godiva cheesecake, the strawberry shortcake dessert, and the salted caramel cheesecake. Side note, the bread and butter there is always warm and fluffy. The brown bread is my favorite. <br><br>Happy service, great food, great atmosphere. Definitely go here!

One thing thats awesome about the Cheescake factory is how extensive their menu is. For those that don&#39;t like too many choices this may be overwhelming but I personally love it. <br><br>So in breakdown by dishes: <br><br>Skinnylicious Tuscan Chicken: The dish was gigantic so if you&#39;re going hungry and considering this it will not do you wrong.
