The sauce soaked in the tomatoes and the farro was mouthwatering. I absolutely devoured the tomatoes. However, the chicken itself was not cooked that well and was very hard to break it off. It also didn&#39;t really have a taste which was surprising because you would have hoped that the sauce soaked into it. I think there are better things on the menu. <br><br>GET THE WHITE CHOCOLATE CARAMEL MACADAMIA NUT CHEESECAKE:So the group I was with for the most part we were all trying to be healthy but this was something we could not resist. The nuts are a perfect compliment to the smoothness that is cheesecake and every bite only left you wanting more. I love white chocolate so perhaps I may be biased but 4/4 of us said we would order it again. <br><br>Key Lime Cheesecake: THis didn&#39;t hit the home run quite so much. It definitely was strong in the key lime flavor so don&#39;t expect anything else. But I personally dont enjoy cheesecakes that are fruity based because I am looking for chocolate. <br><br> The Cheesecake factory has the best stuff in its name - dont go without getting dessert.

Waited for about 30mins for a 2 top, not terrible, it was a Thursday night. We were sat at a small table with other small tables along side us. Not my ideal seating. I feel this takes away from the intimacy of a date night. Our appetizer (mac &amp; cheese balls) was nothing short of delicious. My meal, bang bang chicken and shrimp, was not my favorite. The peanut flavor took over the whole dish and my boyfriends steak and cheese was a little smaller then expected for a sub but still very good and his french fries didn&#39;t stand a chance. Overall I still enjoyed myself and Grace (waitress) was great. I&#39;ll be back just with a different entree choice!!

We came here on Valentines Day, as you could imagine it was very busy!!! Wait was approximately an hour and a half. Once we were finally seated, food and service was good. Waitress got pulled off of our table once and we were assigned a different server, putting aside the confusion service was good. Food was spot on. I ordered the herb crusted salmon/shrimp scampi combo plate. It was great!! We ordered coffee and naturally cheesecake. I ordered the Reece&#39;s pb cheesecake. It was delicious!!! Our server forgot our sugar when we ordered our coffee and we had no plates with our bread early on when we were finally seated. I truly understand the minor confusion as it was busy. Again, with the bits of confusion things overall was decent. <br>    In closing, my two suggestions/requests would be to shorten up their menu. I mean really, when I was done looking at their menu I felt like I just completed reading a book!!! Way too big of a menu and way too many options, seriously. Less at times is better!!! Also, beer options are seriously lacking here. Very few options to choose from. Sure there is the traditional domestic garbage beer on tap and limited bottle options, but nothing spectacular here. I decided to go with the Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. Really it was the only decent quality beer here. In this case mor is better. More meaning more quality beer. Alot of local breweries in the area of Providence. These breweries product should be here at the Cheesecake Factory!!!!

Easily the worst Cheesecake Factory that I have ever been to. Came around lunch time and the wait-staff couldn&#39;t handle their own. Food took forever, waitress had an attitude and it took 15 minutes to get a check. On top of it all, drink orders and the bill were wrong. <br><br>Chain restaurants are on their way out and for good reason.

I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory in OR and CA and this one was the worst experience. <br>It was Friday lunch time so I understand there was long waiting for food. <br>I ordered a spaghetti and meatballs, the meatballs were buried and very hard I couldn&#39;t bit it. <br>I told my server they brought new meatballs but I had to wait quite awhile again. <br>The server apologized me but overall the service and food wasn&#39;t good enough for 2 dollar signs restaurant.

This is my daughters absolute favorite place to go with dad. <br>Food is fabulous and the service is always good. They do get extremely busy and sometimes there is a wait but it&#39;s well worth it. No better place for a yummy dessert after a good steak.

First, the wait is way too long. The table next to us were seated after us, yet were served bread before us. Not a big deal but that&#39;s a pet peeve of mine. The waitress is super friendly and checked on us a few times. I haven&#39;t had meat in months but decided to order my favorite, Chicken Constoletta. The asparagus was cold. Chicken was okay but nothing to write home about. I asked for extra lemon sauce for the chicken and I got it, thankfully because they never put enough on. Ok, so portion size is very large. It&#39;s enough for three meals. Restaurants should start offering half portion sizes with 25% to 30% discount. Many would choose the smaller portion which would be a higher profit. The best part of this evening, was the cheescake and staff singing to my daughter for her birthday, as well as the waitress. Otherwise the place is overpriced for subpar food.

I&#39;m a regular at the Cheesecake Factory and I came here for my first time in Providence, RI after taking the advice of a coworker. I&#39;m a cheesecake fanatic, but the advice was sound, &#34;You&#39;re in a new city, sample the local flavor.&#34; I agreed that line of thinking made sense and it had occurred to me, but I still planned to have some cheesecake since the Cheesecake Factory was just a block away. <br><br>The local fair I decided to try was a let down, and only the beer I had was worth it. So I didn&#39;t eat and beat my feet back up the hill. <br><br>Because I wanted to room for my cheesecake and this place always gives a hefty piece, I opted for 2 appetizers rather than a meal. I decided on the:<br><br>*Chicken Samosas - Crispy wrappers filled with spiced chicken. Served with cilantro dipping sauce. $5.95<br>*Crispy Crab Bites - Bite sized little crab cakes served with mustard sauce. <br><br>While the samosas were good, I didn&#39;t entirely enjoy the pairing with the cilantro sauce, though it wasn&#39;t bad. The crab bites and mustard bites were nearly divine and at 6 for an appetizer, that&#39;s more than enough. <br><br>For the reason I go to the Cheesecake Factory I tried a new cake flavor that I&#39;ve never had. Which was:<br><br>*Fresh Banana Cream Cheesecake - Banana cream cheesecake topped with Bavarian Cream and fresh sliced bananas (I got my bananas on the side.) This is probably officially my favorite cheesecake flavor now. <br><br>I had a wonderful solo experience and can&#39;t wait to sample the food and dessert here in Providence, RI again, or one of my local factories here in NJ
Luisiana pasta dish = awesome!  My go to meal.<br>Great people and food.  <br>Bar was great - servers were on top of game. Busy holiday day and continued to perform
Harmoney was the BEST waitress!!! She has topped everyone and anyone I&#39;ve ever had in my life. GIVE HER A RAISE SHES AMAZING!! Ask for Harmoney&#39;s section y&#39;all won&#39;t regret it!

Went to Cheesecake Factory on Memorial Day around 830pm. It wasn&#39;t crazy busy, there was no wait, and there were many open tables. At no point did it seem overwhelmingly busy or hectic. <br><br>That being said, there were several issues that I could not let go. I am not one to complain about how long the kitchen takes to get food out, but our meals were pushing 30-40 minutes long. One both dishes finally arrived, mine was cold, and my dates pasta was bland and over cooked. She ordered shrimp scampi and she got a bowl of pasta with 4 shrimp (also cold). My chicken parm &#34;pizza style&#34; was room temp/ cold, as if it were sitting in the kitchen window for 15-20 minutes. <br><br>The worst part of all of it, was the waitress didn&#39;t even ADDRESS the issue ! No apology, no offer to take item off, no discount. NOTHING. After being in the service industry for over 10 years, this was something I couldn&#39;t accept. I will not be returning.

Tried again. Why do people eat here?  Stick with cheesecake only. Don&#39;t get a meal here. Turkey burger was just awlful. Like it had been left out in the road for a long while. Small, tasteless, and so overpriced. So I just stuck with fries for dinner.  Hate this place, I always feel ripped off.

Pretty much know what you&#39;re going to get with this place.  Lots of choices, pretty good dessert and usually a good atmosphere.  Had the BBQ burger which was good but slightly overcooked from what I had requested.  Wish they had some better draft options, but other than that, no complaints.  Service was decent, wait wasn&#39;t too bad.  Overall good experience

I go here with my family on every single birthday I have!! Staff disappears for a while &amp; I only had one real problem with this place once. I specifically told the crew member at our table I wanted one thing clarified with them no onions! I have an allergy comes back over to the table and gives me a different pasta dish then what I had even asked for with onions all over it. Also wasn&#39;t the dish I even ordered so the crew member got flagged down by another crew member to fix the order, then everyone at my table has already started eating and  was feeling quite awkward because it was my birthday &amp; I was the only one without food. As it was apparently being remade... the crew member comes back out with again the wrong dish, not what I at all asked for &amp; to be 100% honest looked like the exact same meal that they came out with the first time. Disappointed honestly because I really do love coming here, I&#39;ve come here every year to celebrate with my huge family, but couldn&#39;t even eat what I ordered this year. Pretty upset shouldn&#39;t have had to pay for it just to not eat be able to eat it, I understand accidents happen but when it comes to having an allergy to certain foods and you receive a meal which wasn&#39;t what you asked for &amp; was loaded with something your allergic to, I can&#39;t sympathize.

This is a chain restaurant and has the same feel as the other chains that I have visited. Be prepared to wait...I had to remind them that I was still waiting after they told me it would be a 20 min wait. It was about a 45 min wait instead. The food was ok, but not spectacular by any means. I ordered the Korean cauliflower and veggi burger with sweet potatoe fries. However, my waitress was very pleasant and she took the time to ensure that I was satisfied with everything.  Again, it was ok but not worth me taking a trip up just for standard tasting food.

Big menu with some unique tastes...SCORE!!<br><br>There is most always a wait to be seated-- no reservations-- nor can u call ahead--- NOT COOL<br><br>Service is pretty good and the decor is nice....<br><br>It&#39;s worth a trip for sure!<br>Louisiana chicken n pasta-- SUPER YUMMY

Once, I wanted to get a great experience at the Cheesecake Factory. But I should have known that if drake was fighting there then it can&#39;t be that good.<br><br>Anyways, so I ordered a steak and it came like an hour later cold, and I was like tf? So she said hey I can microwave it. And I was Iike no, steak doesn&#39;t need to be microwaved. My best friends birthday was also going on and she waited 30 mins for a salmon, the waitress came back said oh we don&#39;t got that no mo and offered crab instead came back 30 mins later and she said oh we don&#39;t got that either. And so yeah it was a horrible experience but hey you learn something every day right so now don&#39;t come here<br><br>But the cheesecake was good tho, can&#39;t knock that one extra star

Great service, awesome food, delicious desert to go!!<br><br>The menu goes on forever! There are plenty of vegetarian, gluten free, and even VEGAN options. This is a great place to go with a big party since the menu offered a bit of everything to make everyone happy.<br><br>Also love getting Cheesecake to go because it keeps the fun coming even after you leave.
The Cheesecakes are obviously amazing but should be toned down in price for me to be buying them more frequently!

Such a wide variety of culture when it comes to their menu! They have everything you could possibly dream of! Extensive range of appetizer, drinks, entrees, and desserts! One of my favorite restaurants in RI! Impressive for a chain restaurant.<br><br>Last night I had the Shrimp &amp; Steak Diane which was absolutely amazing, and filled with flavor. Finished it off with my favorite cheesecake, Banana Cream!

I don&#39;t know if it is because it is the age of everyone posting pictures of their food on Instagram or just super pride in their craft, but the chefs at Cheesecake Factory presented their food  better than a chef in a Michelin Star restaurant.  I applaud the presentation and my salmon was amazing.  Keep up the great work.

First time eating real food at Cheescake Factory, we have only had cheesecake before. The waiting for a table process could use a major overhaul. They take your name give you a buzzer, then when the buzzer goes off they take it back and herd you like animals on the stairs. Very confusing process. The menu is so extensive, we needed extra time to make a decision. Buffalo chicken was just ok, alittle dry. The corn tamales were fabulous! Creamy and rich. My pasta needed more sauce. We will for sure go back. The crispy truffle chicken was so good. The coating was so flavorful.
Our waitress ignored us and took about 20 minutes to get our drinks. We split our app, was just ok. Got the Tuna Poke bowl as my entree and NO tuna. Waste of $17. So disappointed.

Went to the Cheesecake Factory with a few friends. We were initially greeted by a pleasant server who stated that the man that was supposed to be our server was on break. Well I wish she could have remained our waitress because once this man came back it all went down hill. This man comes in smelling like cigarette smoke. My table ordered two appetizers one came out, we ate that as we were told the second one will be out shortly. The server goes to take our plates, which i was hesitant to give at first seeing how we still had the second appetizer coming but gave it to him anyway thinking perhaps he would bring us another plate. Well the second app came out 20 minutes after the first with no side plates to boot. Our food comes out at the exact same time as this app that tasted like it had been sitting under a heat lamp. We asked a food runner for a side plate which apparently most of the service staff here is rude because he gave my friend the dirtiest look. We received boxes and a dessert menu after seeing our same server be slightly rude towards the table next to us whom had a service dog and a disabled individual. We ordered our cheesecake because lets be real, we are at the cheesecake factory after all. And our check is dropped before our dessert even hits the table... we took our dessert to go and rushed out. This service left a bad taste in my mouth.
Yup, came back again to give it another try. Food still sucked, but service was improved.

Ordered take out, waited 1 hr for food. I ordered kids alfredo pasta which was still hard, shepards pie, which would be a meat lovers fave since there was hardly any mash potatoes, an everything pizza, bread was burnt n hard, and pork belly sliders which was probably the best option and well made. Would i go there again? Sure, maybe it was just an off day for them. We shall see

Can&#39;t speak about the food as we couldn&#39;t get past the drinks to place an order. Went late night last night. It was about midnight. They close at 2. Hostess was very nice. Took a while to be acknowledged by our server. When he finally came he was pleasant and we (my daughter and I) ordered tea. My husband ordered beer. The server bought out bread, sourdough I believe, and we also requested the brown oat bread since he didn&#39;t bring it out. He said he &#34;thought&#34; they had some and when it came out it was warm. The problem is that the glassware and silverware were both disgustingly dirty and caked with food-not thoroughly clean. Even if it is the end of the night please take time to make sure utensils and such are clean. We ran our hands over the knives and all three were dirty! You could feel the particles caked on them. Not a little but disgustingly so. Needless to say we left but not before informing the manager, who seemed as if he couldn&#39;t  care less. He actually had a look of &#34;how dare you request clean cutlery&#34; -like we were bothering him. We are from out of town but will not return and if you take a chance and visit this location, especially late night, make sure your dishes are clean. I don&#39;t eat off of dirty dishes at home and I definitely wouldn&#39;t do it out either. Just gross. Unfortunately I&#39;m sure some don&#39;t check and will end up eating with dirty utensils and drinking from dirty glasses.. Nasty. Take my advice and check your items out.

From the start.  <br>No call ahead seating we waited in a cold area for 45 min<br>The buzzer they wanted us to hold smelled like a dead animal.  It probably was not disinfect in weeks.<br>We sat down in the middle of the restaurant and it is about 60 degrees.  <br>I asked for heat and it just got colder the excuse is it is because the doors keep opening.  I would expect this from a small local tavern not at a million $ chain.<br>Ordered food and they are out of 2 things I want.  I am here with a gift certificate.  We had to ask for water and a piece of bread for our meal.  So far I blame management not our server she is pleasant.   We ordered non alcoholic beverages.  <br>15 min and the bread finally comes out no bread dish.  <br>Our children are now waiting for food ours is here and getting cold.  I never eat without my children getting their food it is just plain rude.<br>Food came out for all and it tastes great.  Portion is good.  We just went from a 1star to a 2 star because we are rating the entire restaurant experience, Not just the food.  <br>Deserts are good but my Linda&#39;s Chocolate cake is frozen $9 per slice for a cake made in a warehouse not their kitchen.

Here is the Cheesecake Factory response to why they have decided to recommend that guest tip on tax <br>Thank  you for providing your feedback regarding our suggested gratuity guidelines that are calculated on the post-tax check total. It was a decision by our company executives to use this figure and we do so in all of our restaurants nationwide. Prior to printing a suggested guideline on our checks, we did review different restaurants in the high casual dining segment and found that the practice was mixed. Some were calculating pre-tax and some, post-tax.<br> <br>I am sorry that this decision has disappointed you, and will share your feedback with our company executives. We appreciate feedback from our guests and often use it to shape future decisions.<br><br>Sincerely,<br><br>John Marotta<br>Guest Services Specialists<br><br>Cheesecake Factory Customers Say They Were Duped Into Leaving Big Tips

I love this place but my past 3 orders through Grubhub were less than satisfactory. My steak Diana was well done and not medium rare, my pot stickers were saturated in your special soy sauce instead of on the side as usual, my bread? My bread? Omg you guys sent me two Small ass pieces!!! Super disappointed right now

I don&#39;t usually write reviews of the Cheesecake Factory, but I had to take a minute and write one for this particular location, mainly because the service here was just fantastic.<br><br>I wish I could remember our server&#39;s name, because she was the sweetest girl and provided better service than we&#39;ve had in many far more expensive restaurants.<br><br>The food was also fantastic:<br><br>-- Bread - always a highlight. I always eat WAY too much of it, thus why I order off the Skinnylicious (sp?) menu.<br>-- Singapore Shrimp Rolls - I think this is what they are called? Anyway, these were my entrée and were delicious.<br>-- Child&#39;s Bowtie Pasta - my 9-year-old devoured this. <br>-- Baja Chicken Tacos - my husband devoured this. And he rarely devours anything.<br>-- Linda&#39;s Fudge Cake - One of the best desserts we&#39;ve ever had, anywhere. This is the main reason we venture out to Cheesecake Factory.<br><br>Overall: Sure this is a chain restaurant but it&#39;s a really good one. I just wish they&#39;d open one in NYC!

This place never ceases to disappoint! This time I came in just for some cheesecake and decided to get a slice of the Tuxedo Cheesecake! Wow oh wow was it good. Every bite was just a little piece of heaven. There is a reason this place exists and it&#39;s that heavenly cheesecake and variety of flavors. Thank you Cheesecake Factory.

You know what they say about first impressions.  Believe it or not, this week was my first time ever going to a Cheesecake Factory restaurant despite having heard great things about both the food and desserts for quite some time.  The place was very busy, so its understandable that it may take a while, but I felt that the wait between apps, main course, dessert and even the check was quite long.  At one point we were wondering if they forgot about our table.<br><br>The food to me, in general was ok.  The apps which consisted of calamari, nachos and stuffed mushrooms were all good.  No complaints there.  The entree I got was the spicy chipotle chicken on penne.  It wasn&#39;t bad, but it had some sweetness to it that didn&#39;t seem to fit.  Others that I ate with that had been there before commented on how the food tasted rushed as it was much better when they had been there previously.  The overall consensus was disappointment.<br><br>For dessert I got the banana cream cheesecake and tried the Godiva and tuxedo slices as well.  All ranged from good to ok, but not good enough to makeup for the wait or the main course.  The apps and our server were the only saving graces from going with a lower rating though a 2 1/2 would be more accurate.<br><br>As I told my girlfriend, I wouldn&#39;t say I&#39;d never eat there again, but I wouldn&#39;t go out of my way to go back and its not on my list of places I must go back to soon.

stopped here for a quick bite before going to the movies<br>cheesecake factory has definitely stepped up their game with &#34;healthier&#34; options. <br>My gf and I ordered on the skinnilicious menu<br>we got lettuce wraps (3 large bibb lettuce, filled with tender grilled chicken, shittake mushroom, red cabbage, and cucumber) that came with a chutney (way too sweet) and a spicy peanut sauce (which was delicious<br>we also got the summer rolls (vegetarian- asparagus, sesame noodle instead of the traditional vermacelli, cucumber and carrot) also had two asian inspired dipping sauces. I still stuck to the spicy peanut sauce.<br>while not authentic in any way, still extremely tasty. <br>we opted not to order more so we could get a jumbo extra buttered popcorn later!

The service was exceptionally slow. We were seated at 3:05pm and we left at 5pm. Horribly slow. Daughter had the filet, it was mediocre, my shrimp scampi was amazing(this earned the extra star) Probably won&#39;t go back.

My friend and I were visiting Providence together on 6/18/18, and decided to eat at The Cheesecake Factory while we were downtown.  While the restaurant had a bustling crowd around 7:00 pm, we were seated quickly, and were treated very kindly by the host and hostess.  We were seated in a section with a very pleasant waitress named <br>Grace Mari B (as stated on our receipt).  She took our drink and food order, and was very kind, friendly and attentive.  Shortly after she took our order and brought our drinks, a couple came in that was clearly her good friends or possibly family, and then they were seated in her section, right beside us.  She was excited to see them, and they carried on an extensive, robust conversation.  After our waitress stood there and visited with her friends for several minutes, she proceeded to sit down with them, and extend her visit at their table, spanning more than a 25 minute time frame.  We kept wondering where our food was, and finally after a good 30 minutes, a mysterious person appeared to deliver our food.  While our waitress continued to sit with her companions, we were never asked if we needed anything, if our food was to our liking, or if we needed drink refills.  She actually behaved as if she had completely forgotten we were there.  When she saw that we had completed our food-which was pretty good-she got up and gave us a bill, and stated that it had been a complete pleasure to serve us.  I felt that this was a thinly veiled attempt to salvage a good tip, after we had witnessed her complete ability to ignore us as we dined in her section.  I felt cheap.  Meh, poor representation of a good establishment, she should be ashamed.

I&#39;ve been to this particular restaurant countless times now with various party sizes and have yet to be thrilled with the quality or speed. <br>A large group of us came in around 5 for dinner. We were told the wait was 2 hours or to sit at the high top tables - which we did, fine, no problems there. Our waiter was a cool guy and did well serving us.<br><br>The drinks were well presented and of decent size. I asked for my mojito to not be too sweet. It was too sweet and progressively sweeter with each order as if my server or bartender forgot the detail.. Each mojito was $12.95.. which is a totally incorrect price for a chain restaurant. $10 would have been more appropriate. Their meals in general were, in my opinion, a few dollars more than they were worth in many instances too. <br><br>I ordered Baja Chicken Tacos. The tortillas were [for some reason] double layered and mushy to the point of falling apart. The rice you could probably chip a tooth on.  I only ate the inside of the tacos and small side order of beans. Most of the others at our table ordered burgers which were decent. I tried someone&#39;s fries when they came out and they were room temperature. One girl did not even eat 1/5 of her burger and our server did not ask if she liked her meal (she did not). <br>All in all, I felt overcharged and unsatisfied with the general quality of food. I won&#39;t be coming back.

Cheesecake Factory is good for just that cheesecake... The other items on the menu are overpriced and not always on point. We waited 45 mins for an appetizer of boneless buffalo wings that tasted like franks red hot x 100. Then our meals arrive but only 2 out of the 4 the other 2 came 25 mins later.... 140$ for 4 and not an awesome experience. I have had better. The chicken potstickers tasted like the sauce they were in --- the cheesesteak sandwiches were fair.
The service here was amazing, the food was very good.. except when I ordered the ceaser salad it was DRENCHED in this awful dressing that tasted like straight onions and garlic.

This place is very city-life like and nice inside. I absolutely hate how all of these restaurant are in a mall though. The closest one to me is this one at Providence Place, and I hate Providence Place Mall. We only come here when we get gift cards; but the food is good, especially the desserts and cheesecake (obviously). However the service is mediocre and you have to wait FOREVER. We once waited in line for 45 minutes and then they sat us at a table that was so crowded. My elbow could have touched the stranger next to me. Not the place for a quiet and romantic dinner. We asked for a booth and thankfully one opened up just as we requested one.

An update as the decline of the cheesecake factory continues!!!! ......this is on par with their numerous recent health code violations by the way......I&#39;m only here because of a gift card I received for my birthday. I didn&#39;t know what to get so I go with something I&#39;ve gotten many times before....the orange chicken. In the past the chicken has definitely been a slightly better quality and the vegetables were way too salty this time around. Too much soy sauce. My boyfriend got the Catfish. I tried a bite and it literally tasted like pure dirt/mud. We Google immediately what the flavor is supposed to be and come to find that the dirt flavor stems from not being washed/soaked properly. YUCK!!!<br><br>He asks to take it back and get something else. This time the chicken and biscuits. It was good except when I took a bite, got a little crunchy sensation. <br><br>Previously I had asked for a ginger ale which I don&#39;t know why took so long. So she finally brings out a small bottle of Canada dry that has already been opened?!?!?!?! Wtf.<br><br>Prior to this also she brings my boyfriend a water with dirt on the outside of the cup!!!!! Like come on people. Open your eyes before bringing guests stuff!!! Overall our waitress was not the best nor the most attentive. The couple next to us got more attention and service for sure.<br><br>Straighten the fuck up cheesecake factory, your health code violations weren&#39;t too pretty so I&#39;m guessing you could get shut down! Tonight is my last night here.
This review is from awhile ago. Tried to eat here on a freezing cold day and we were greeted at the garage entrance &#34;we are closed because restaurant can&#39;t get it together &#34; Really

I have a friend who loves cheesecake as much as I do - she and I have tried all of the cheesecakes here. The winner of our &#34;Cheesecake Bracket&#34; was the Red Velvet, but I like to save it for special occasions. If I were to get a cheesecake on a regular day, I would go for the lemon raspberry (the tangy lemon mousse and ladyfingers keep it light, and the raspberry sauce is actually surprisingly genuine), tiramisu (fun and creative interpretation of an Italian classic), or the cherry cheesecake (the classic with sour cream topping and a cascade of sweet and tart cherries - only for cherry lovers!). Oreo Dream Extreme is also amazing, if you like oreos (profound, eh?). <br><br>Why the 3 stars? While service is usually good, once in a while there&#39;s a waiter with an attitude. Also, the savory food is really not that special. The only savory food I would order again is the blue cheese, pear, and walnut flatbread - a cliche yet scrumptious combination of sweet, salty, nutty flavors. The perfect appetizer to a dinner of cheesecakes (you need something savory to keep yourself sane). As long as you make cheesecake the main event, you&#39;ll have an enjoyable time.<br><br>P.S. You know that brown oatmeal bread they give you? That stuff is good with whipped cream/cheesecake smeared on top. You&#39;re welcome.

This is prob one of my favorite restaurants. Every time I go I get the bang bang chic and shrimp. Their cocktails never disappoint. To drink I had the pin apple mojito and ultimate margarita. My fiancé had the Kobe beef burger and my daughter Delilah had the grilled cheese. Everything was amazing.! Now I have been here before and received pretty poor service but didn&#39;t hold it against them because I am in the industry and the food is still Delish. This review however is specifically for our server Anthony S. <br>He was very fun. He didn&#39;t have to read specials off a little notepad but he remembered it and all while not sounding like a robot (I hate that) he was for the most part being himself which is awesome. He was extremely patient with my four year old Delilah who had a lot of questions that Anthony had no problem answering. He made her smile the whole time. When the food came out he was concerned about delilahs plate being hot so he brought out a side plate and even helped her cut it so that it could cool off. <br>I am in the industry and have been for 11 years Anthony actually taught me something last night and I thought I knew it all. What a great server. If he&#39;s not the head server you should most definitely make him one and he would also make an excellent manager. I will deff be back and ask for Anthony. Thanks Anthony!!

I hate to admit it, but I really do like The Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m not a huge fan of chain restaurants and this place is wicked overpriced, but as much as I want to hate them, I just can&#39;t!<br><br>Every time I come I have to get the fried mac &amp; cheese. It is like heaven. They make balls of mac &amp; cheese and then bread, deep fry them, and serve over a pink/red sauce. They are so cheesy, crispy and addicting!<br><br>Recently my boyfriend ordered the pear &amp; blue cheese flatbread, and it was one of the best things we have ever eaten. The combination of flavors was wonderful and all of the toppings were very fresh. The blue cheese crumbles were HUGE and had a bit of a nice smokey flavor. Our only complaint about it is that the serving was much too small.<br><br>We also loved the zucchini, portobella and avocado fries. They were nice and crisp and not greasy or soggy at all. On the side it came with two dipping sauces that were very good.<br><br>Once I&#39;m done eating here, I never have any room for cheesecake.... and that&#39;s sad because it&#39;s really the best part. Luckily they can always box up some slices for you to take home.<br><br>I&#39;ve never had an issue with the service here. They&#39;ve always been nice and well trained staff.

PLEASE STAY AWAY FROM THIS PLACE. My boyfriend and I used to come here about once every two weeks and order food, drinks and dessert. In a regular night out we were waiting for our food and saw a roach that was crawling up next to me. We told our waitress as we did no longer want our meals (yet we&#39;re willing to pay for the drinks we ordered) and when she came back she just told us our meal was all set. We asked to see a manager because this is obviously a problem and no one came out. I called and they told me to call back at a certain time in where I did and never ended up getting transferred. Please don&#39;t waste your money here any longer. I wish I would have known this sooner.

Came here a couple times during happy hour to try out their $6 happy hour appetizers. I&#39;ve also had Evelyn&#39;s pasta and the black pepper shrimp dish.<br><br>I would not recommend the pot stickers, pepperoni kids pizza, chicken sliders, Evelyn&#39;s pasta or black pepper shrimp. <br><br>I would recommend the tex mex egg rolls.

The food was very good ans tasty.  Also I love their selection of healthiest choices.  The staff is very friendly. My husband is a picky eater ans d he love his food. I got one of  the combinations dishes delicious.

Well I will admit the cheesecake is the best ever! At 8$ a slice it should be. Not impressed at all with this place though. Went in the afternoon for dessert and it was slow. They tried to seat us in a small cramped table near the bar next to a family with six kids. We asked to sit outside and the man said &#34; I will have to check to see if it&#39;s ok&#34;. Ok with who? Since there were six open tables outside. He went to the front desk where the woman said hey I guess it&#39;s ok. Like really? Why wouldn&#39;t it be! Disappointed in that for sure which removed stars for my review. I wouldn&#39;t suggest sitting outside though to anyone reading this. It&#39;s loud and the traffic is to much for conversation. People passing by swearing and seriously some looked like they would steal your bags of given the chance. The cheesecake definitely is why they got three stars from me. Other than that no go because of the way we were treated. They said it was because in case they got busy but they were not busy so why can&#39;t you chose where to sit? Next time I will get it to go as I always have. My mistake. Two cold brew coffees and two slices of cake 35$.

Came for a marriage retreat with 32 people and asked for seating together. Was told it was not possible so everyone had to break into groups of 4. <br>Poor customer service and extremely disappointed with the service. Once seated it was very very slow service!!! The food was okay but service all around was way too slow and we were exhausted and didn&#39;t enjoy it that much. Definitely would pick another restaurant with a group next time.

I always have been a loyal customer to the brand, but this place has a great staff in regards to customer service. Even though that doesn&#39;t cut what I came for, the food was poorly prepared and was very tasteless. I ordered a chicken ceaser salad , and it tasted like a clove of garlic with cheese and the chicken was more like eating unseasoned cauliflower. My pregnant wife had a Cajun chicken seafood pasta that was so bland and noodles undercooked, now that is very unhealthy for any woman caring a child. They took the food off the ticket when she requested it from the waitress. I&#39;m truly disappointed and this place needs to scrap the cooking staff. Another reason I gave it a star, is the silverware was set on the table and not even a napkin or anything to keep it from touching the table that numerous people have been sitting at. I wouldn&#39;t recommend this Cheesecake Factory to anyone.

I love their Happy Hour!!! It makes me want to sing. <br>Monday - Friday, 4-6pm, $5 apps<br><br>My favorite appetizers are:<br>The fried zucchini with ranch sauce. I don&#39;t even like zucchini!<br>The Tex Mex Rolls (yessss!): $9.95<br>The crab cakes (more like crab balls) are pretty good! $12.95<br><br>The location is splendid - right in the mall, so you can shop and then draank!<br>The drinks are not the strongest, but their not weak. I also love the fact that the space is always brightly lit during the day with a lively, trendy vibe. The Cheesecake Factory is a good go-to for Happy Hour or dinner with friends. Everything I&#39;ve tried has been satisfying thus far. <br><br>Parking Available in the Mall Structure

An oldie but a goodie, the Cheesecake Factory (<a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.thecheesecakefactory.com%2F&amp;s=0b467d6e6b241cd6852de828d75278ff3fb437ee52cacf35dbf31b0ef919f149" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">thecheesecakefactory.com</a> )  at the Providence Place Mall is always a treat. Going there as a part of Tom&#39;s Birthday dinner, was a treat. Always a beautiful restaurant, well kept, and great waitstaff. <br><br> While we have been here many times, the large selection on their menu always causes a long debate. However, this time I couldn&#39;t branch out I had to re-try the Orange Chicken. I had ordered this previously at a different location. it came out beautifully garnished and with a strong orange scent. Who would think, Chinese food at the cheesecake factory could be so delicious. The flavor was one of the boldest flavors I have experienced when ordering Orange Chicken. My only disappointment was the lack of sauce, I live for the extra sauce on the place and due to the beautiful garnishments and presentation there was no extra sauce to be had! This was such a light, refreshing chicken dish prepared with a light and crunchy coating.   <br><br>Louisiana Chicken Pasta, this was an AMAZING dish. This was a  Parmesan Crusted Chicken Served Over Pasta with Mushrooms, Peppers and Onions in a Spicy New Orleans Sauce. The New Orleans sauce was to die for!! Such a bold cream sauce, packed with flavor really made the dish. The chicken was perfectly coated and baked, but the best part was the sauce... I truly cannot rave enough about this sauce! This is a MUST try dish, that we will be ordering again!!

What Happened to the Factory?  Was seated for 2 with my wife, the waitress walked by 5 times never said a word. 22 minutes into our outing we walked over to the &#34;To-Go&#34; counter, the girl behind the register looked me dead in the eyes, turn her back and went on break, Didn&#39;t even say hi...or someone will be right with you. 5 minutes later we walked out completely un-served. The floor is a Super greasy, it used to be by the kitchen only, now it&#39;s slick from the kitchen to the stairs, down both main aisles and even working it&#39;s way toward the bathrooms.<br>The lights are always too dim, I wonder why? This place has gone from riches to rags they are a dead man walking.  <br>Don&#39;t waste your money, for the same price as one dinner for 2, you can buy a frozen dinner, and the microwave needed to replicate this garbage.<br>Please note how sad I am having to write this reveiw.

We were there for Sunday lunch. The restaurant was just half full. Our server was sweet and nice but another server spilled sauce on my husband while she realized she was at the wrong table. She wasn&#39;t even aware of it. We brought it up to a server that walked past us and she grabbed a napkin to clean up the sauce spilled on the floor but didn&#39;t acknowledge when we told him the sauce was spilled on the clothes too. <br>It was a bad experience
We were seated promptly, and the bread and appetizers came quickly. The food came in HUGE portions, tasted great. Service was okay; waited a long time to order cheesecake but it was delicious!

Wasn&#39;t pleased. First off it was freezing in there, everyone had on their hoodies and jackets. Then the drinks were not strong at all. Stood at the bar for at least 20 mins before the bartender acknowledged us. Then when we ordered the entree my friend asked for no shredded cheese and extra mozzarella and they did the complete opposite, gave him shredded cheese and very little mozzarella. When we said it to the waitress she just said okay and walked away, didn&#39;t offer to take It back or anything. Service could be better

This is my favorite place to have brunch on the weekends. The pancakes are in my top 5. I usually get the new cinnamon pancakes. Everyone needs to try it at least once in their lifetime. I love this place. The food is exquisite. My all time favorite is the 4 cheese pasta with shrimp.

SHOUTOUT TO OUR SERVER BRYAN R! I&#39;ve been to TCF more times than I can count, but last night&#39;s service prompted me to want to write a review. Our server was absolutely amazing. He was attentive, refilled our drinks numerous times and checked in on us every time he walked by. Usually the service here is okay and sometimes subpar, but last night we were very pleasantly surprised. Reason for the four stars is really their lack of appetizer options available last night. Also, the food is good, but not five stars good. We shared a fried cheese appetizer, since the stuffed mushrooms and  avocado egg-rolls we wanted were not available anymore for the night. It was good, nothing really memorable. I ordered the sausage and shrimp pasta and it was delicious. My friend had the four cheese pasta and the sauce for that dish was very tasty too. All in all a good place for lots of comfort food. Thanks again Bryan R for the great service!

Came here last night at 11, was able to get a table.  We were tucked by the bar and ordered drinks, &amp; pot stickers. The drinks were very good, the pot stickers were overdone and burnt. The waitress Mariell was very nice and attentive. I didn&#39;t like that the table wasn&#39;t properly set up, and waitress could tell I was dissatisfied and made sure to be very accommodating.

Well, the CCF is your run of the mill restaurant and extremely overpriced. And I mean EXTREME! Like...unnecessary. <br><br>None of the apps are cheaper than $8 that I saw. Most were around the $9-12. And we&#39;re just talking apps people!!! This isn&#39;t some fancy, 4 or 5 star restaurant. This is the CCF...a chain restaurant.<br><br>Okay. I got the chicken quesadilla app. It&#39;s HALF a quesadilla, 4 slices. This is a perfect portion for an app to share with someone before a meal....for $6 not for the $12 it actually cost. And because everything is so overpriced, I decided to only have an app as my meal. However the price, it was a decent quesadilla. Not the best, but I enjoyed it. <br><br>The cheesecakes that I took home were $15. This I don&#39;t mind because I&#39;m not about to make a banana cream cheese cake for fun at home. It was by far the best cheesecake I have ever had! Ugh I really loved it. I&#39;ve also had the Oreo, which is good, but was just too rich for that whole piece. <br><br>So I gave the CCF 2 stars because there were only two good things about our visit. 1) banana cheesecake 2) our waiter was super friendly and honest about the food when I asked. <br><br>Atmosphere is fine. It&#39;s huge! And loud, but so am I, so that balances itself out. No long wait on a Saturday for lunch. Too many options on the menu. Overpriced. Will not be returning except to get cheesecake.

This place is way to busy. Be prepared to wait at least half an hour for a table on any weekend night. The food is mediocre and way over priced. The drinks are watered down. This is an average chain restaurant with average service and average food. The only good thing I have to say about this location is that the cheesecake is amazing, which should be expected because it is called the Cheesecake Factory.

Worst experience. Went there on Friday night with my family for dinner. There was a wait for the table and while waiting my 11 month old son slept in his stroller. After waiting for 20 mins, when I asked for the stroller to be taken with me to the table they didn&#39;t allow it. Have to say, this restaurant is NOT infant friendly.

I&#39;m not big on chain restaurants but I make the exception for this place. FYI read a menu before going they have so many choices its like reading a book and will save you time choosing. I love the food but I usually get the same meal every time. The chicken marsala over pasta. I have not tried one better anywhere else yet. And no cheesecake will compare to theirs. Why you ask? I&#39;m not even a fan of cheesecake. But theirs taste so good! And if you are full after your meal just take one to go. That is after you finally decide which kind you want.

I can&#39;t for the life of me fathom why people frequent this restaurant with such ardent fervor. It. Is. Terrible. The worst. All around. <br>First and foremost, the service is beyond terrible. The servers are plain rude. My wife called to make a reservation. The first server told her they couldn&#39;t take reservations until 12:30 and hung up. When she called back, a different server told her they don&#39;t even take reservations. They aren&#39;t any nicer in the restaurant. They ignore you while you&#39;re waiting. Once we were finally seated, they barely came around. We were there two hours. No wonder the line is so long. <br>Second, their food is nothing to write home about. My eggplant parmigiana was cold and was on par with Olive Garden. My wife&#39;s chicken and avocado salad was so bland and unimaginative that it&#39;s hardly worth mentioning. <br>And I can&#39;t stress this enough: the cheesecake is not that good. Seriously. If you&#39;re from Boston or Providence, go anywhere else and it will be better (and less expensive). <br>My parents love this place but to me it&#39;s overpriced and overrated. Go to any other Italian restaurant in Providence (Pano e Vino for example) and you&#39;ll be much more satisfied.

This location has been here for quite some time,  and I&#39;ve been several times before today (first few years when they first opened). Over the years I&#39;ve stayed away from the run of the mill cooperate chain restaurants. Although they do have one hell of a menu, a nightmare for servers and bartenders I&#39;m sure (since I am one I can relate), I&#39;ve noticed a steady decline in details. One example,  the table we were sat at was not wiped down. Not even an attempt to wipe it down was made. It was sticky to the touch and covered in what looked like some sort of kosher salt. Perhaps from a pretzel app or margarita glass. There was salt all over the table. It wasn&#39;t busy when we came in for lunch. The waitress was friendly. I asked her to choose between two pasta dishes for me and she nailed it. I would have given less stars but she brought up my rating. I think I&#39;ll stick to Federal Hill for my pasta cravings.
We had dinner here and ordered from the &#34;skinny&#34; menu.  Burger was good, fries were good, and the steak medallions were great!  No problems with the service.

Waited about a half hour for a table &amp; once we were seated at a table we were ignored. Sat for almost 8-10 minutes without being introduced to a server or waitress &amp; had to witness horrible service &amp; issues at surrounding tables. (Hair in food, and delayed chicken appetizers.) <br><br>I called over someone who resembled a manager role to bring this to her attention &amp; she seemed rather blank &amp; unconcerned. <br><br>It&#39;s awfully sad to write this, as I traveled over an hour to providence to dine here with my family. We ended up leaving after no help and heading over to other favorite, Joes (down the street). We&#39;ll eat here two days in a row anytime!

Like most restaurant chains, you know what you&#39;re getting into when you visit one. The food, service and price is often predictable and that remains true with this particular location. This restaurant is an easy choice if you find yourself near the Statehouse or train station.
Horrible customer service and forget about getting any answers or professionalism when placing a call.
I think they have too many items on the menu to do anything really well.  I have been here several times and haven&#39;t been wowed in years.

The usual! Lol. Very nice tho. But just don&#39;t sit outside in the summer. There were bees or wasps  (I&#39;m a city girl, I don&#39;t know the difference), they literally ate off our plates. My friend ordered the eggs, which were no longer over easy by the time they got to the table...

Fantastic as always - great service and the biggest salads we have ever seen. Had the BBQ ranch salad and a side of guacamole (which was massive). Difficult to resist the temptation for cheesecake after it all!

This place has a big menu, good food and good drinks. Just a heads up, when you get there, you&#39;ll wait long enough to turn a boy into a man. Bring a board game or something with you to eat up the time. Long wait to be seated and longer wait to get your meal. Probably should bring food with you to hold you over. Don&#39;t be surprised if you see people die of old age all around you.

Ever been to a place and feel like you shouldn&#39;t come back again. That&#39;s this cheese cake factory location in Providence. Right in the downtown occupying prime real estate. What a waste of my time for choosing the worst customer service ever. This incident happened last night 06/23/2017.<br><br>It started with me and my friends waiting for 5 mins to 10 minutes to be noticed by a receptionist . There was no one at the reservation table. After asking a guy who was adjusting the menu, he helped us out and got us seated in 10 mins which was a pretty quick service. <br><br>There comes our waiter- tries his best to show off with his specials menu and then asks for a drink. Once the drinks are placed he hurries us for the order, at that point my friends and I order appetizers and were in no mood for entree. The guy gives this nasty look which my friend feels offended . I brushed it off saying he  probably didn&#39;t mean anything. Once we were in the middle of our appetizers he comes back and asks for anything else. At that point I ask him for dessert recommendations. He points at the menu on the table next to me and says give me the menu. I was taken back and offended by way he asked (rude and demanding) and when I asked him dessert recommendations again, he repeats three times to give him the menu on the table . There was no please or may I have the menu please?. At that point I was furious after handing him the menu and he turns to the picture on the menu and says I wanted to show this. This is all in his condescending, arrogant attitude. I wasn&#39;t sure what his problem was, I am not sure if it was because we were brown skin ( this is the first time ever I had encountered this kind of incident ever) . I didn&#39;t want to confront him for his behavior , I politely asked him to call his manager. By the way the waiter name is Anthony. <br><br>Manager showed up and said he was sorry on behalf of the waiter . I asked for a different waiter/waitress which he did. (the new waitress was courteous and professional and even apologized at the end for his colleagues behavior) .I asked the manager if there is going to be any follow up about what action he will be taking, he didn&#39;t have an answer. I insisted I would like to know and I will be posting a review on yelp for response. Manager told me I could post one but he can&#39;t answer to it . <br><br>I am not sure what policies does cheese cake factory has to deal with this kind of behavior by one of their staff members. The manager did try his part to be professional, but had no information for further response. I would definitely like to know and let others know how we won&#39;t tolerate this behavior.
I got the Chicken Alfredo pasta. It was not anything special and was actually quite bland. They also took almost 2 hours to deliver this...

Sat at the bar and ordered Ahi Tartare. They gave my order to another customer. After waiting 30 minutes I sensed out my order wasn&#39;t comming.When they figured out the mistake they said they would rush out the order.10  minutes later a manager came over and apologized and said she would go to the kitchen and wait for the order.10 minutes later after the bartender asked what was taking so long for the rush order someone went to the kitchen and picked up the order.Bad service and charged full price,the customer who got my order wasn&#39;t charged.

This is my first time going there (10/27)<br>Heard from many people how good the place is. Unfortunately I don&#39;t share the same sentiments. <br>I ordered Chicken Marsala ( a standard faborite at many places I dine at) it fidn&#39;t taste like any Marsala I&#39;ve ever had before, in fact, it was very tasteless, watery, amd bland. The sauce was blah! <br>Prior to the meal, we were brougt warm bread ( always a good move for a restaurant) but the white bread was too hard to eat. <br>Ordered their namesake = cheesecake.. Good,<br>But nothing record breaking! <br>While we ate rather inexpensively, I have had much better for less elsewhere. <br>I will give another chance for redemption, so we shall see!
Two hour wait is never ok after you are told an hour. My mom almost passed out as we waited in a packed lobby. Never again.

The Cheesecake Factory is one of the few chains that brings me back. Why? Consistency and always adding items to the menu that deserve to be on there for years.<br><br>The good thing too is if you want to eat healthy, you can (I know sans cheesecake) but if you want to treat yourself, CF is there for you too.<br><br>An underrated cocktail selection is always on the rotation for the season. Service is always top notch.<br><br>The only issue that many complain about, no reservations. Key for you then is to go to CF on a weeknight right around 5-6. You try on a weekend and you will be waiting for at least 45 mins.

Salmon was bland. Asparagus cooked perfectly. But really, Cheesecake factory, a glass full of ice and fruit with maybe 3 ounces for sangria for $11.50??? Waiter was Chris. He was great.<br>Probably won&#39;t go back. There are way too many good local restaurants for the price we paid for lunch here. Salmon(lunch size) and garlic shrimp(4) Sangria, ice tea, two slices of cheesecake to take home. $70.00 before tip.

We went to eat on Sunday Jan, 14th at 12pm . I noticed all customers were in coats and hats. Yes no heat. We didn&#39;t realize this until it was to late. After asking waitress she advised get used to is that is the way it is. Needless to say I wouldn&#39;t go back because who could have enjoyed a meal with it being 12 degrees outside and feeling the same inside. The manager didn&#39;t apologize nor did the staff. <br>Very unprofessional .!!!!

I&#39;ve been to this place so many times and have always gotten the same plates. I get the Jambalaya or the Chipotle pasta are my favorite. The service is great but it tends to be very packed so you&#39;ll probably have to wait for a table.

Lunch : that moment to yourself during the hectic workday.  <br>Friday Lunch : ...freeeedooomm! <br><br>My department was ordering lunch today and, rather than be the &#34;party-pooping vegetarian locavore&#34;, I set my preferences aside and went with the popular vote: Cheesecake Factory.  [shrug] -ok!  Each location has its own take-out menu, so I perused the 20pages of massive meaty meals to find (aaaaalllllllllllll the way at the end) the light/&#34;SkinnyLicious&#34; menu of low(-ish) calorie items.  With pear and blue cheese in sight, I made my selection: Pear &amp; Endive salad (claiming to be under 590 calories....good....it&#39;s a SALAD!) : Grilled Chicken, Endive, Radicchio, Arugula, Butter Lettuce, Roasted Pear, Blue Cheese, Candied Pecans and Tomato Served with Our SkinnyLicious® Vinaigrette&#34; $13.95.  Sounds pretty good, right?  I placed my order (sans poulet).<br><br>Friday antics resumed until our coworker returned with the order.  The &#34;call-out, carton pass&#34; ritual ensued until we were left with one box, and my empty hands.  &#34;What the heck is THIS?&#34; my coworker joked and he poked at the last massive take-out box.  I peered inside at the scant layer of wilted greens and three tiny blue cheese crumbles.  &#34;Must be mine....&#34;  I reported in a disappointing tone.<br><br>The serving was LESS than my coworker&#39;s SIDE SALAD (yet placed in a MASSIVE box, perhaps to add extra insult for declining the poultry), and there was no pear at all (sooo it was a soft-lettuce and blue cheese CRUMB salad?....for FOURTEEN DOLLARS?!).  What I *DID* consume was relatively tasty; your typical &#34;sugared American salad&#34; to appeal to those who don&#39;t like vegetables.   I was 100% disappointed in the time it took to process the order, the flavor, and the most PA-THET-IC excuse for a FOURTEEN DOLLAR salad that I&#39;ve seen in a long time.<br><br>Lesson learned.  As the Genie in Aladdin said: &#34;Remember, bbbeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee yourself.&#34;  I wasn&#39;t true to myself when I ordered this flop.  Cheesecake Factory: you might be able to fool others with your loud ambiance, your &#34;fresco&#34; décor, and your bajillion-calorie desserts......but in the city of truth, there are so SO many better options than your sugar-coated menu

Just ate at Cheesecake Factory, not for the first time though. It&#39;s always been an ok experience nothing special. Food was ok, drinks ok, and usually the wait staff is ok, but this time it was exceptional! We had Katie M as our server and she was amazing! Very attentive, very spritely, and overall made us very happy. We had a server before that and she changed out with Katie M and we are thankful for that as she was a lot more attentive and happy serving us.
Great vegan cobb salad. Hardworking, attentive staff, extensive menu, reliable consistent food. Appreciate the service very much.

Great date night restaurant to go to!! We&#39;ve come numerous times for a nice dinner out! Expect to spend a little more here, but it&#39;s totally worth it!! The menu is huge!!! So much to choose from!! I would usually opt for the pasta alfredo, ugh seriously amazing! And my other half would usually get the orange chicken! And we&#39;d split a cheesecake! The size of the meals are pretty large. Most times you&#39;d have enough for take home for the next day. <br><br>The staff are nice and the wait time is usually right! Whenever they say the wait is 20 mins, we wait 20 mins and not anymore more. <br><br>If you get up to use the restroom, just be careful! The staff run around like crazy!!! I&#39;ve come close to bumping into someone booking it out of the kitchen to go wait in a table! Or people carrying out cheesecakes for the front counter.

Overall the cheese cake factory is a nice place with a lot of choice. We had to wait more that half an hour an the connection with the buzzer was lost and we had to wait for another 15 min. We were seated in the back and it was freezing out there. Most of the food was nice but don&#39;t take the Evelyn&#39;s favorite past, that tasted like nothing. The Godiva chocolate cheesecake made up for the pasta. <br>Good to know is that there are gluten free options.

No matter how annoyingly big the menu is, how crowded it is on a Friday or Saturday night, or how ridiculous it is that a pasta dish is $15+... I will forever keep returning The Cheesecake Factory. <br><br>Sure, it&#39;s a little pricey for a chain, but the portions are incredibly huge. If you&#39;re super hungry, it&#39;s worth it, or you can take home leftovers. Win-win.<br><br>I have a love affair with the Chicken Bellagio. I remember when it was a new special on the menu years ago and I&#39;m so happy they made it a permanent menu item. I have a really hard time ordering something other than that when I&#39;m there, but I&#39;m getting better at venturing out. It&#39;s easy with such an insanely big menu.<br><br>The nachos are amazing but more filling then you could ever imagine (even without chicken on them). My boyfriend and I made that mistake... ordered nachos for an appetizer and got entrees. Never again. Now if we&#39;re in the mood for nachos, we get another small appetizer to split. Usually the chicken sliders. They&#39;re amazing.<br><br>My boyfriend was only disappointed in his meal once -- a Hawaiian pizza that was seriously undercooked and looked like it was frozen. He didn&#39;t eat it, we were comped, and it was okay. Now, he stays far away from the pizza. Luckily, there are a million other options for him to try.<br><br>We always get cheesecake to go, because I would actually be worried about my well-being if I tried to eat a slice of cheesecake after such huge portions. <br><br>Overall, I really do love it here. It&#39;s one of the only chain restaurants I don&#39;t mind frequenting.

Mmmhhh! It is so delicious! Devine!! I mean it&#39;s a cheesecake haven. You can&#39;t be disappointed. Well, okay, you can if you pick that line cake. Also their food is pretty good.<br>With that being said, Juniors is still the best.

We wait 50 minutes<br>and finally sit and wait 20 minutes to first waiters come to us ask drink and then after 10 minutes our drink order come to us and my diet coke no taste and no acidic properties  and I asked to waiters he told to me Soda Fountain some problem and he charged to me this un-drinkable soda order<br><br>But we ordered classic food and food is 8/10 nice and delicious not 10/10 I Guess this Cheesecake need some training and modernization and choose more careful waiters and etc. <br><br>Garson ( Waiter ) not a trained and fast but at the same time good humor and person I left 10 percent tips because he charged to me soda price<br><br>Alex

Visited on a Saturday evening. Very crowded. Had to wait for 15-20 mins before we got our seat. Expensive. No dedicated parking available, just few street parkings nearby. They have outside seating, enjoyed that part. Service was fast and server was courteous and helpful. Food was delicious and top notch. Really liked their authentic classic cheesecake.
Best Avocado egg rolls. The staff was very courteous and friendly. The food was amazing.

My all time favorite. I have lived in several different states and trust me this is the only place that doesn&#39;t fail to impress me every time . Great pastas, entrees ,starters. Food is ALWAYS on point. Love coming back here over and over

I don&#39;t know what&#39;s going on with this place the last few years....This waitress we had today was probably the worst I&#39;ve had in the 10 plus years I&#39;ve coming here....the only thing that keeps me coming back is the food, because the service is terrible lately.  To start off, i asked her for Coke with lemon....she brought it to the table and it had no lemon....then I asked her for more butter for my bread....and she never brought it....it seemed like the food was NEVER! going to come, and every time she would go by the table she would never ask us if we needed anything, not a drink refill or nothing......mind you there was nobody in the place....not busy at all, so quick service shouldn&#39;t of been a problem....FINALLY! the food came....and thank God the food was better than the service....I wanted desert but I didn&#39;t feel like waiting another half hour for....it took long enough for the meal to come out....the service was so bad we had to ask another waitress for our bill....<br><br>               Service like this can ruin a restaurant, it certain doesn&#39;t make me wanna return anytime soon....and it&#39;s too bad cus the food is very good....and that&#39;s the only reason why I come back.... <br>             I hope they step up they&#39;re game!!

Been a fan of Cheesecake Factory for years. This location is very similar to others I have been to. The wait can be very long if you come in on the weekends, sometimes as long as 1-2 hours. Today after shopping for bridesmaid dresses with my bride-to-be sister and her bridal party we decided to treat ourselves and ensure that we will never fit into said dresses. The bread - amazing, as  always. Our waiter was nice and attentive, which is usually my experience here. I ordered one of my faves, the chicken bellagio. Two large chicken cutlets over pesto pasta and a small arugula salad. Everything was prepared perfectly and tasted great. We skipped dessert (I know, a sin) as we were all very full and hoping to not have to be rolled to our cars. <br><br>The menu is extensive and the cocktails are always very good. Depending on what you order it can be a bit pricey but it&#39;s almost always worth it. I def come here when it&#39;s time to splurge and have a cheat day.

Even though the wait was quite long , the food and service was great! Our waitress Kymberli was sweet , friendly and incredibly efficient with all the workload she had that night ! Next time I visit , I&#39;m asking for her ! Well done

Came here on a Sunday night with my bf. Don&#39;t get the water until 15mins after seated. Don&#39;t get to order until 15 mins later. Total wait before the server got our order was 30mins. I ordered salmon with medium diane steak and my bf ordered scrimp gumbo. The dishes don&#39;t come after another 30 mins. The steak (chunks) was fully cooked even slightly burned, and they looks like pieces cut off from the side of other bigger steaks. We told the server and she put in another order so I didn&#39;t get the steak I&#39;m hoping for until another 30mins. And you can see the host is not very happy about our request to replace the dish. <br><br>Our total stay in the restaurant was about two hours and it completely ruined out movie plan. Pretty disappointed about this CCF branch.

Whenever I walk into a chain like The Cheesecake Factory, there are some things that I expect. For this restaurant, I expect to peruse the menu for at least half hour without reading every item and for my entree that I eventually select to be on point. This location delivers just that, but it&#39;s what I received outside of that expectation that encouraged me to write this review.<br><br>The service here is something to be mentioned. Not only is is it welcoming and efficient, but the staff here goes out of their way to make sure that you are as a guest are having the best time possible. When you go out of your way to have a nice dinner, you want to make sure that you are going to get just that and then some. And while a successful chain like The Cheesecake Factory doesn&#39;t need much praise to keep them in business, I think a staff like this one deserves some necessary praise.<br><br>Kudos, y&#39;all!

Wait time was ridiculous.... I don&#39;t know what the Waiter we&#39;re doing but we waited 20 minutes to have someone just ask us if we wanted bread and water. There were people that got seated after us and received water, bread, and appetizers before we even had someone come take our order. The food &amp; drinks came quick and the bread arrived shortly after.... The food was great and it usually is but the horrible service ruined an enjoyable night.  The waiter was even slow with taking payment of the check. He brings the bill and takes our order for the cheesecake(to go) but is in such a rush that he doesn&#39;t take my card to pay for the food. He comes back with the cheesecakes and finally takes the check. From that moment my girlfriend and I waited another 10-15 minutes after seeing the same waiter lap around the restaurant with my debit card in his pocket. If it wasn&#39;t for my girlfriend I probably wouldn&#39;t have tipped the waiter nor pay for the food due to horrible service.  I love the Cheesecake Factory but when things get busy in there it is literally a circus and these people working here have little to no idea of who to serve first once customers are seated. There is literally no reason someone seated after me should be served water, bread, AND APPS before someone even comes to ask if we have been served....

I came here from MA to meet up with some friends. We arrived to an almost-empty restaurant at 11 am on a Sunday, and by the time we were finished eating, the restaurant was PACKED.<br><br>The nice thing about Sundays is that they offer brunch! It&#39;s a little something different. The food is good, and a bit cheaper than lunch or dinner offerings. Come early!

Well I always come here with my wife to eat at the bar and always order 4 to 5 items from $5 special. Food is great as always but some of the server are gross and have bad attitude like Stacey.  Sorry if I don&#39;t spend enough but it&#39;s what I want to eat. ......<br>Thats why I left only $2

I have been waiting in line to get my 8 year old daughter a gift certificate for over 20 minutes.  The manager (?) has been dealing with the same customer the entire time and they keep passing the customer&#39;s phone back and forth.  This is the worst service that I have ever witnessed in my life.  <br>I understand problem customers, but enough is enough. Also, where is some extra help to alleviate this ridiculous situation? Is it a computer situation? Override it.  The line is getting hostile. <br>Now up to 25 minutes.  I&#39;d leave if my daughter didn&#39;t want to come back here so badly.<br>There&#39;s a waitress who can&#39;t leave until she checks out here and no one seems to care about their own employee!!<br>Not even 1 apology at this point.  <br>Utterly unfathomable service.<br>F- overall.

Their world famous brown bread is sooooo good... from Los Angeles to Providence!! They always been served warm and soft... <br><br>The kobe beef burger is to die for!!  The patty itself was very yummy and perfectly cooked the way i want it, medium rare, so juicy but not bloody!!  I like they buttered and toasted the bun, so many places out there (such as Joe&#39;s, sorry, I have to be more specific), u will be surprised they never bother to buttered before toasted the bun! When the bun is buttered, it wont be soggy by absorbing the patty juice! Personally i hate burgers/ sandwiches soggy, but who want them soggy anyway?! <br><br>I miss their appetizers platter which is no longer on the menu........... ;(

Ate here today with my mom and aunt. My mother got crab cakes and stuffed mushrooms. and my aunt ordered flatbread pizza and a side salad. I picked two items. First, I got something new from the &#34;small plate&#34; options, Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets (if you&#39;ve never had Nashville Hot Chicken, it&#39;s fried chicken brushed with a spicy paste that includes smoked paprika and cayenne pepper, then served with dill pickle slices and white bread). For my entree, I picked a filet mignon grilled well done, with mashed potatoes. To drink, we all just had ice water.<br><br>My mother and aunt only said they really enjoyed their food, not saying too much more about it. I really liked the Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets (any time I can get boneless chicken is a plus) they were a different take on spicy chicken than buffalo wings, and pickles were a nice touch. Unlike hot chicken served in Nashville, this did not come with any bread, just pickles and a side of ranch for dipping. My filet was cooked just as I wanted it, juicy and flavorful, with no pink in the middle.<br><br>I know that Cheesecake Factory is one of those restaurants where the prices are on the expensive side, but I didn&#39;t even see how much the bill came to, because my aunt snatched it up right away, and announced she was paying for lunch, and didn&#39;t want any arguments. No problem here.<br><br>Our waitress was friendly and attentive (frequently coming by to see if our water glasses needed refilling, and doing so without us having to ask her). Our food did take quite a while to come out from the kitchen, but we attributed that to the crowded dining room.<br><br>I&#39;ll be back soon. I hope they keep that Nashville Hot Chicken on the menu.

Really good food. Their menu is vast, with many favorite ethnic varieties and appeals. Like their other locations, this TCF is quite elegant. The decor appears to me like a fusion of Venetian and Egyptian art and architecture. When you go, don&#39;t forget to leave room for dessert - especially, of course, for their cheesecakes.

I had originally come in just for cheesecake and the original person I spoke to was so nice and told up to sit if we wanted to eat even thought they were closing shortly. The waitress I had never told me her name and barely came to check up on us throughout our meal. The drinks were warm and ice melted quickly. The food was not worth the hype and completely overpriced. Cheesecake was am amazing but the over all experience was shit

Yesterday was my 32nd birthday, my girls surprised me with munchies and cake at the Cheesecake factory, which use to be my favorite restaurant.<br>When we talk to the front desk to make arrangements for a table it was a 45 minute wait but it was okay we knew it was going to take that long anyway because it&#39;s such a popular place. My friends go and tell the front desk this is our best friend&#39;s birthday please do something really special. The front desk stand  (female, African American &amp; gentleman) stated of course we&#39;re going to embarrass her will do something really special and they complimented on how Young I look. I was so excited.<br>45 minutes later we are lead to our seat. They let us up the stairs and I thought we were going to the booth dining room area but they made us literally took a loop all the way around the restaurant just to sit right where we were sitting waiting for us to be called. That was slightly annoying. <br>The gentleman who served us was very quiet made no Small Talk whatsoever. Asked us what we wanted to drink we give him our drink order and our appetizer order and we wanted to look a little bit longer on the menu. He did not come back to take our order until 15-20 minutes later. Then he disappeared for another 15-20 minutes, returning finally with drinks and our appetizer. We tell him our order, which we ordered several slices of their cheesecakes for all of us to sample. <br>The slices are huge and they tasted amazing but when he came back he just dropped off our cakes and walked off but back back two minutes later with the entire staff to sing happy birthday to another table across from us. <br>They looked completely stunned because they did not request nor had a birthday in their party. Comes to find out they screwed that up so we just paid the check and left.<br>The food and cakes are amazing, the service seriously stinks...I am gonna sadly find a new location that not only have great food, desserts and extremely better service.

Coming back the food was Amazing. So good I couldn&#39;t put my fork down , but very filling. The bread they gave in the beginning was fresh and toasted perfectly on the outside. I ordered the pizza which is cut into 10 slices and reasonably priced and filling. The dough was soft with a bit of crunch to it and just really good. Finally trying the cheesecake was just out of this world! I ordered the chocolate chip cookie dough cheesecake which includes a bottom chocolate crust layer with regular cheesecake and humongous globs of cookie dough with walnuts drizzled on top and in the cookie dough. I can&#39;t forget the whipped cream they put on the plate and on top of the cheesecake. Lastly the chocolate chips they sprinkled on each whipped cream circle. Why you may ask this is only four stars? If the food wasn&#39;t good then this would have been another one star for me. We waited 2 hours and 32 minutes to be seated. No reservations could be made on Sunday, so we took our chances and went in at 4:15 for a 5:00 dinner. They said an hour and a Half wait so we put our name down for the next available table and we went to the mall next door and looked around. Nearing the hour and a half mark we went back to the restaurant and was told another 20 minutes. Ok another 20 minutes we can live without it. There is one small booth to wait which was filled to The max with people. So we waited and waited, our feet getting tired of standing , our stomachs grumbling and then our buzzer vibrates. We arrived at that restaurant at 4:15 and was seated at almost 7:30 with the exaggeration of only 20 minutes left. This restaurant lacks severely on their waiting times , waiting area and just front organization. It was a mad house of people, squishing In everywhere waiting. In the way of other people eating , in the way of waiters and waitresses, just complete chaos. Our server was very nice though , and checked in about every 20 seconds asking for refills. So that was good. We had two servers in the beginning but one of them went on break and forgot to tell the other one of my friend&#39;s order and she got her meal while we were eating dessert. At least our other good server continued to be wonderful and asked if she wanted any bread or food to tie her over until then. One server was amazing(wish I caught her name ) , the other terrible. The waiting was horrendous , but the food was good. Will come back but never on the weekend again.
My favorite place to go out for dinner in Rhode Island. I have an amazing experience every time I go to the Cheesecake Factory and the food overall is great

So I decided to go to the Cheesecake Factory. My first mistake was sitting outside. The tables and floor was so disgusting and the smell was horrible. I ordered the fish soft shell tacos with fries. When the dish came to my table it was 4 small soft shell fish tacos with the smallest piece of grilled fish I&#39;ve ever seen. The service was very slow. Note to self &#34; NEVER COME BACK HERE AGAIN&#34;
Brought ten different slices of cheesecake to a Christmas party. It wasn&#39;t cheap ($80+) but everyone loved the variety with the slices I brought. TCF really knows how to make a good cheesecake!

Came with a party of 8 right at 11:30 opening time on a Saturday, no wait. Our waitress was really nice and the service was excellent. Food was amazing, a little pricey. My husband and I got the mac and cheese balls, sooo good. I had the Crispy Pineapple Chicken and Shrimp, it was delicious, better than anything ive ever ordered at a chinese restaurant. Everyone in our party loved their food. They even came by and sang Happy Birthday and gave a small dessert to my neice. We got cheesecake to go and it was fantastic!!!
