Waited 45 minutes to be sat which, wouldn&#39;t be a big deal if I didn&#39;t watch at least 4 other parties of the same size who arrived after me get sat before me. Sit down at the tiniest table in the whole place. Then the food gets to the table and there is a piece of aluminum foil cooked into my chicken (underneath the breading). Waitress takes the plate back no problem, they just remove the piece of foil and bring back the same food. And they didn&#39;t offer to remove it from the bill nothing.

I came here at least once a week. Tonight was the worst night ever! We waited almost 40 minutes for our meal. The waitress didn&#39;t even bother us to let us know why it took so long?  We were sitting outside and there are 8 tables. Obviously one waitress is not enough to take care for all table or our table!! I don&#39;t think I&#39;ll come here again after slow and careless service!

We went for a late dinner last Saturday evening after a show at the Vets. Lucky to grab the last two seats at the bar. We were met by a miserable bartender who was obviously put out by having to clear the spot for us. We should have just taken this as a sign and went elsewhere- but it was late. <br>Things got so much worse from here. Let&#39;s talk food. That second star up there is for my husband&#39;s burger. He loved it. I opted for the lettuce wraps. The chicken was not edible- it had not been cleaned properly...don&#39;t need to further elaborate.<br>Atmosphere- would have been great- but there was an inch of dust on the bottles located above the bar- makes you wonder what else is dirty that we cannot see!<br>Now back to that sweetheart of a bartender . He began to talk to the girls seated next to us about his co worker with bad body odor, and complained about a customer wanting the celtics on the TV. This guy has no place in the front of the house. Nice etiquette. <br>This review is being written after I contacted the establishment directly with my concerns and was not acknowledged. They obviously do not care about their guests experiences. <br>Word to the wise- grab a table and skip the lettuce wraps.
This place is really nice, a little pricey but at the same time it is in down town, there is no parking lot, need to find parking on the street. My kids loved it as we did too.

Normally I like the Cheesecake Factory. Love their deserts. So we decided to order some tonight through Grubhub. We Place the order and it says an hour till delivery. Perfect we are out anyway. My wife orders cheesecake for her and one for our son. I order the strawberry shortcake. My favorite mostly cause the vanilla ice cream is so good. So the order comes and everything comes except the ice cream. So I call them and get placed on hold and no one ever comes to the phone. So after 15 min waiting- I hang up and call back. They answer and I get put through to a manager. He proceeds to look up the order and I tell him what has happened. He then starts talking to his manager and then hangs up on me. Probably by accident but at this point I&#39;m very irritated with how this has gone. So I call back again. And their response is- you&#39;ll have to call Grubhub hub and see how long it&#39;s gonna take for them to come back. Mind you it&#39;s not Grubhub&#39;s fault the order is wrong and I&#39;m not going to have a guy come all the way here and not get paid for CCF&#39;s mistake. Plus I&#39;m not waiting an hour for it. So I tell him just to refund the money. And he say, ok I&#39;ll have it put back on and then just hangs up on me again without saying anything else. And now here we are. Since I&#39;m pretty sure they don&#39;t want me to call back and scream. And I don&#39;t want to do that either. Plus it seems like I wouldn&#39;t get anywhere anyway. This whole thing was Very poorly handled all around. And I&#39;m very disappointed in how it all transpired. Makes me not want to go there anymore. Which is saying something since it&#39;s one of my wife&#39;s favorite places.
Fully straightened out.  I went twice in the past week and everything was spot on.  I&#39;d definitely go again.  No complaints.

Their Gift Cards Expire. <br>Sus tarjetas de regalo caducan !<br>So think twice before you buy someone a gift card as a present. If they don&#39;t use it in time, The Cheesecake Factory keeps the money.

I&#39;m writing a review for here in R.I. but have been to many in the states along the east coast from Providence, RI to West Palm Beach, FL... ALL have been consistent with their entrees. The only chain restaurant where I know what I&#39;m getting. I&#39;ve eaten so many entrees over the years, haven&#39;t pix of all of them...LOL. Never disappointed. Have been frequenting this restaurant for the last 20 years, mostly in NY, NJ, RI and FL. They serve a great Thai dish, burgers, the Sunday brunch is great. And you get the most bang for your buck. One tip when visiting any of their restaurants, if you do not want to wait any length of time for a table, head over to the bar area and the few hi-top tables where if you wait there or see people leave their spot, you&#39;re free to then take it.

Miserable customer service.  I called weeks ago to make a reservation for 15 to have a family celebration.  I called today to confirm.  Despite looking at my reservation while on the phone with me, both the person that answered the phone and later a manager refused to honor the reservation because they &#34;don&#39;t take reservations.&#34;  They did let me make the reservation and now with 3 days to go I need to find another restaurant that can take the 15 of us or wait another 6 weeks.  Apparently they were just going to let us all show up and stand there and wait for the next table of 15 to open up.  Ridiculous!  Never again.

Ok let me preface by saying that the food was really very good. If it was just based on the food i would give it 5 stars. Initially the server was great dinner came and that was basically the last we saw of him. When another server came and brought our food she asked my wife if she wanted freshly grated parmesan cheese on her pasta. My wife promptly said yes and waited to take her first bite for the cheese to arrive....it didnt...at all. My wife decided to forgo the cheese and start eating. We ate dinner and moved around the appetizer plates as the server never came to clear them. FINALLY someone came to clear the plates and we were asked if we wanted desert. I ordered a piece of cheesecake and one to go and a cup of coffee. Again cheesecake delicious, coffee was lukewarm at best. I have to agree with another reviewer when he askes the question why do we keep coming back here???

I honestly only come here for dessert. The last two times I&#39;ve been here my experience with the food hasn&#39;t been great. One time I ordered the fish and chips, and the fish was drenched in oil and was still raw. The other time I ordered a steak and asked for it to be cooked medium and it was cooked well done. <br><br>I also witnessed the couple sitting next to me re-enact Drake&#39;s Child&#39;s Play music video and get into a huge argument. I&#39;d be surprised if they&#39;re still together.

Cajun jambalaya &amp; Chinese chicken salad  is the best ...............cheese cake is melt in your mouth delicious great for business gatherings and date nights I would highly recommend the Oreo dream extreme and Reece&#39;s pb chocolate cake,

The service was average the food was okay &amp; to top it all off let&#39;s just talk about this super long black hair that my husband took out of his mouth after biting into his cheesecake. I love this place but that&#39;s just disgusting! I dined in with 4 other adults &amp;my daughter. I bought a soup, entree &amp; 2 salted caramel cakes to go . I spent 60 dollars on just myself . I&#39;m just so grossed out lol . I&#39;ve always loved this place not sure if I&#39;ll ever get the cheesecake again though. Lol

Just get the damn cheesecake to go.<br><br>My family had a gift card that we received at Christmas for this fine establishment. <br>We arrived at the restaurant around 730pm on a Saturday and were told that the wait would be approximately an hour for the four of us. We were find with the wait (its Saturday night, there is going to be a wait wherever we go) and were handed a pager. <br>Around 845, we still had not been paged/called. I went up to the host and asked how much longer our wait would be, seeing as how they told us an hour at 730. He said that we were next on the list and it shouldnt be any longer than 10 minutes for a table.<br>At 9, I went up again to the host. Said it had been 15 minutes, and asked if we had been forgotten as people who were waiting that arrived after us were being seated. He said we werent on the list, and insisted that he had paged us 10 minutes ago. I had the pager in my hands. It had never gone off.... He said &#34;Im paging it right now.&#34; as I held that pager that was not going off right in front of him. So, CLEARLY your pagers are not working properly and your ignorant host(s) have no clue what they are doing...<br>Fast forward to when we order, my husband and I ordered salmon and pasta, both of which came out together... My SIL and BIL food was no where to be found. TEN minutes later, the waitress walks by and notices that they dont have their burgers.<br>She comes back with the burgers and tells us the places are EXTREMELY hot... which in the restaurant world means &#34;Sorry, your shit has been sitting under the heat lamps for a long ass time so if it tastes awful, my bad.&#34;.<br>My BIL and SIL didnt touch their burgers, they were completely inedible. They looked disgusting.<br>The waitress took both burgers off the bill... By this time it was close to 11pm... We got cheesecake to go and left.. <br>Which is what we should have done to begin with.<br>NEVER AGAIN.

I personally dont understand all the negative posts.   Are you hoping management will give you a gift card to come back if you whine loud enough????<br>Of course the wait is going to be long, its attached to a huge mall, near the statehouse, and the train station, and on a very busy main street.   Were you thinking it&#39;d be a 5 minute wait???   Hell, even The 99 has an hour long wait at times.   If waiting is such a problem for you, order-out.  Yes, The Cheesecake Factory menu IS available to-go.<br>Now as far as the menu... Yes it has alot to offer.  I would think thats a bonus.  You certainly cant get bored of your menu choices.  To have that many options, and to have them arrive at your table well prepared deinitely says something about the kitchen staff.   The food is always delicious!!!!<br>I have NEVER had any issue with the waitstaff.  EVER.   They&#39;ve always been sweet, interested, and attentive.<br>My guess as to why you need to go outside to the restaurant is so they dont have to close when the mall does.  Remember theres also an entrance inside the parking garage.<br><br>Lastly...the cheesecake.    I almost always have a hard time choosing which one to get.  Whenever I go there with friends we always order different cheesecakes so we can take turns trying each others.
Obnoxious waitresses. Not surprised ppl haven&#39;t been giving this place a good rating...

Eh. I&#39;m so just &#34;eh&#34; about the Cheesecake Factory. And it&#39;s not the fault of anyone at this particular location. It&#39;s just hard for me to rave about such unravable food.<br><br>I will say this location is very clean and the service is prompt. Unfortunate, however, that they do not take reservations, particularly as they are located within the Providence Place Mall. I have been told on a number of occasions the wait would be close to or exceed two hours. Very few places in this world are worth that kind of wait, and CF is certainly not one of them.

If you&#39;re ever up for a gastronomical challenge, come finish a single slice of cheesecake by yourself without exploding from either being too full or too overloaded with sugar. No, they&#39;re not terrible; they&#39;re just giant, giant slices which are extremely sweet.<br><br>Sizes follow the same gargantuan theme when it comes to entrees. However, I find the entrees overpriced simply because they aren&#39;t tasty enough to justify ~$15 a plate! You will probably get a meal and a half out of the serving, though, so I guess there&#39;s that.<br><br>This is a good place to come with a big group because they have oodles of seating available. Their menu is also varied enough to cater to a wide range of palettes; everyone in your party is likely to find something they want (vegetarians included). Service has always been pretty good in my experience. Pity about the quality/price disconnect, really.

Absolutely terrible experience here. The night started off ok and our waitress seemed nice and whatnot but after placing our order we waited 20-30 min for our meal to arrive with no assurance from her. she took it upon herself to entertain the table next to us who arrived after us and brought out all 3 plates of their food without even acknowledging us still. I honestly felt like we were discriminated against or they just really have horrible customer service but I will never return to this establishment or a cheesecake restaurant ever again. this is the 2nd bad experience I&#39;ve had at a Cheesecake Factory in 2 completely different locations. West coast/east coast. I&#39;ll stick to Bj&#39;s from now on. I would suggest the same for anyone looking to be treated with respect.

Love this place. It gets busy but it&#39;s Friday night just after the mall closes and just about a 15 minute wait...not bad. Although dinner time can run ya 1hr or better so beware. Haven&#39;t had much I haven&#39;t liked from here. Cheesecakes to try are the pineapple upside down and the white chocolate raspberry and the apple pie one. I highly recommend the chicken samosa appetizer it&#39;s not spicy and no crazy weird flavor in case your not that adventurous ..you will love it trust me. ;)~

The only thing that sucks about the Cheesecake Factory is their system of taking your buzzer only to have you wait again at the top of the stairs shoulder to shoulder with every other lump until someone else call yours name, other than that the place is great......orange chicken, lit.... factory burrito, lit..... plain Jane pizza, lit.......Spicy crispy chicken sandwich either flavor, lit.......Cheesecakes,lit..... Tex mex egg rolls,yeah u guess it LIT!

Go for the cheesecake.<br><br>My girlfriend received a gift card for the Cheesecake factory so we decided to have to appetizers and drinks before going to the movies at the Providence Place Mall.  The restaurant already had a line forming at 4:30 so we sat at a high top at the bar.  Our server seemed completely disinterested in us, and I was disappointed there were only 3 draft beers available, sam adams, sam adams winter, and blue moon.  So I ordered a tall blue moon and my gf got a strawberry basil margarita.  Little did I realize, upon checking some of the reviews on here, that there was a happy hour from 4-6pm, as our server never informed us, nor gave the special happy hour menu.  Whether or not this was to get us to buy items not off that menu (which are 15-30% cheaper) I don&#39;t know, but when I asked her for a happy happy hour menu she seemed confused.  Long story short, we ordered (from the happy hour specials), the beet and goat cheese salad, buffalo chicken pot-stickers, tuna tartare, and pretzel crusted chicken.<br><br>My beer was flat, my girlfriend&#39;s drink sugary and lacking almost any alcohol, for 10 bucks a pop on those drinks you expect something half decent.<br><br>Our food took over 30 minutes to come out to us, which I understand it&#39;s busy but these were all appetizers that didn&#39;t require much attention.  All I took away from this was a mild stomach ache.<br><br>If you like the Cheesecake Factory, by all means go nuts, but for now I&#39;ll just stick to the cheesecake there (which ironically I didn&#39;t even want after going this past time).

We decided to go out after the PC Friars game and all I can say is I am glad we were using a gift card we received at Xmas because if I had to pay for this food I would be extremely disappointed. First, we were seated at a table less than 1 foot away from another table. We were so close to the other customers that we all joked about the fact that we don&#39;t usually sit that close to people we know, nevermind strangers.  The server Liz was friendly but way to busy and she chastised the busboy for his apparent lack of speed, right in front of us and it was really uncomfortable.  We ordered Nachos that cost $12.00 and I wouldn&#39;t pay $5 for them! We also ordered a shrimp app called Dynamite shrimp that came out after we had received our meal.   By the way, this shrimp was anything but Dynamite!  But I guess calling it rubbery crappy shrimp wouldn&#39;t sell very well.  Best part is, after they brought the entrees they left the Nacho plate on the table so our dishes were hanging off the edge if the table.  I had some chicken dish called spicy cajun chicken bites. Well it was chicken and eating it definitely bites but it was not cajun. Pretty much tasted like a McDonald&#39;s chicken McNugget. I also got ice cold potatoes served on a scorching hot plate. Almost chipped my tooth on the potatoes and burned my hand on the plate. My girlfriend had the ICE COLD fish tacos and to her credit, almost finished one. They were nasty like the rest of the meal. We waited an hour for a really bad experience. Don&#39;t be a sucker lile us! Youre better off going to Taco Bell or McDonald&#39;s!  I will NEVER go to Cheesecake Factory again!

I&#39;m not a fan of chain restaurants.  At all.  <br><br>There is always so much hype about The Cheesecake Factory, always.  &#34;It&#39;s so good, Danielle, you HAVE to try it.&#34; Blah blah blah.  <br><br>Admittedly, I&#39;ve been to Cheesecake Factory a few times with friends who&#39;ve dragged me, tooth and nail.  We&#39;d be out shopping and they&#39;d get hungry and begin to rave about some dish they ordered from CF and we&#39;d end up there.  Please note - this is not by choice no matter how much I&#39;d fight and try to reason with them.<br><br>The menu is like war and peace; no word of a lie.  It&#39;s so darn confusing trying to figure out which mediocre dish to order over the other mediocre dish.  I could spend an hour just looking at the menu.<br><br>I&#39;ve never had a stellar experience at CF; service is horrible and there is ALWAYS a wait.  Why?  I don&#39;t get it.  Drag ass a mile up to Federal Hill and actually eat some good food. <br><br>The food is greasy and weighed down, the portions are too large for any normal human being to ingest in one sitting.  <br><br>BUT.  The cheesecake?  It&#39;s actually pretty darn good.  The Oreo cheesecake especially, although; you put an Oreo in anything and it&#39;ll taste phenom.

I had yet another really outstanding/original Mojito Innocente variant, this time at the bar at The Cheesecake Factory in the Providence Place mall in Providence, RI on Mon 8/18, which was made with muddled blueberries, lemon wedges and mint leaves.  I have a name for it (using the standard acronyms for additive (RGB), subtractive (CMYK) and &#34;primary&#34; (RYB) colors), but the name is 2-dimensional:<br><br>    C<br>    M<br> RY(G)B<br>    K<br><br>Where:<br>    C = Cyan, <br>    M = Magenta, <br>    R = Red, <br>    Y = Yellow, <br>    G = Green, <br>    B = Blue <br>    K = BlacK  <br><br>Any suggestions about how to &#34;down-project&#34; this 2-d name onto 1-d space (i.e., a single line of characters) would be much appreciated.  TIA!

Had to wait in line for take out for a good 30 min.   Ok, no big deal.   I ordered an appetizer and two slices of cheesecake to go.  This was at 7:54 pm.  At 8:30 I had to ask where my order was and they said it was just sitting there next to the register with other orders.  That I had to go back online and pay for the order.   I had just given them the receipt for my order that showed it was paid for.  A couple minutes later they give me my order and ready to go.   35 min for an appetizer and two cheesecake slices to go......   next time I&#39;ll go to the bar and order my appetizer there and have the rest to go

We had such a great experience here and had excellent service. Our server Anthony S made this special occasion even better.  I highly recommend the Cheesecake Factory and I think all servers should take lessons from Anthony.  Great time!!

My wife and I went here on a Friday evening. The place was very busy. There was a wait for tables so we decided to sit at the bar. We actually enjoy sitting at the bar when we go out. It&#39;s great for interacting with other people and bartenders. The cocktails are very good although a bit pricey. The bartenders were super friendly. They were engaged in converstaion with the entire bar. Both bartenders were highly trained and they had to be because this place is VERY BUSY. The menu is extensive and the food is very good. The location is awsome also. There&#39;s usually something going on at the waterfront and there&#39;s lots of people walking around. Great place for a date night etc. We will definitely be returning.

I had the Godiva chocolate cheesecake it is   excellent , as always this is my fifth time having that the diver chocolate cheesecake I highly recommend it if you are a chocolate lover. Not too sweet ,rich dark chocolate

I don&#39;t usually give 5 stars.(lets go with 4.5)<br><br>PRO&#39;S<br>1. awesome food, everything is good.<br>2.average wait is 20 to 30 minutes.<br>3.great drinks<br>4.great ambiance. <br>5. no dress code.<br>6.great service.<br>7.lots of cheesecake. <br><br>CON&#39;S<br><a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2F1.no&amp;s=abec404469590d68a3983bfef936acff17b77ef6a945d1741657850b539f7647" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">1.no</a> reservations<br>2.terrible parking.

I go here south because I work almost right next to it!! Love the food and the portions they give!! Not to mention the cheese cake is out of this world way to many to choose from! Big downfall is that you might have to wait like an hour for a seat at times because of holidays or even weekends! Bummer food is so good&#39; not to mention  service is Superb!!

DON&#39;T COME--BAD SERVICE. Last night I had dinner with my friends at the first floor. After we paid, the waitress did not give back our cards. We found out this morning and we had to take uber to the restaurant  to take them. The lady with glasses at the counter helped us take our cards back, without saying anything. So I explained the situation again to her, to indicate how their people caused our inconvenience. After hearing what I said, the lady simply relied &#34;ok, I give your cards back.&#34; SHE DID NOT EVEN SAY A SORRY. She acted like it was my own fault. I once liked their cheesecake so much but I THIS IS MY LAST TIME HERE.

Great meal and service! Sat by the bar on a sunny afternoon, lots to see.  Skinny shrimp tacos were delicious, especially with added jalapeños and sriracha sauce on the side.  The skinnylicious menu is very extensive for those of us looking to stay within moderate calorie consumption!  The mango key lime cheesecake also a great choice if you do not mind the flaky coconut texture.

We have eaten here before and everything is always good. This time I would say our visit was a 10 out of 10!<br>Joe B was our waiter and from the moment we sat down and he brought my 2yr old a cut up banana with brown bread I was happy! He was friendly and very helpful with my husbands shellfish allergy.<br>I asked about the soup of the day and he offered me a sample. <br>Everyone I have ever met at the Cheesecake Factory is nice and friendly but Jay made an extra effort and I hope he is recognized for it.<br>Thank you Jay for a wonderful dinner, we will be back to see you. <br><br>We ordered the Blue cheese and pear flatbread to start, it was amazing<br>My husband had the fried chicken sliders and the beet salad for dinner and said he would order it again. <br>I tried the Thai lettuce wraps and again, awesome!

Last Wednesday my girlfriend and I went here for a late Valentine&#39;s Day dinner. She&#39;s gluten free so all she wanted was a grilled chicken. Instead, they brought out breaded chicken. She told our waiter multiple times that she was gluten free. She then told our waiter she wanted grilled chicken not breaded. Took them well over a half hour to get her just a grilled chicken. And our cheesecakes were VERY small. We&#39;ve had better experiences there.
Ummm two dollar signs? That&#39;s all well and good, but draft beers are 8.50 a pop. Probably 1.50 from a liquor store. Unreasonable. Service was good.
Pricy but definitely worth it! My favorite is the Salmon. I don&#39;t advise getting an appetizer because the bread is filling and delicious!
My new favorite place. Good food, I was sat right away, and our waiter was very polite.

The appetizers were good and of course the cheesecake is great. All four of the entrees we had were awful. We barely touched them. I remember them being better in the past. The bill was pretty high and we felt like we wasted our money. I might go for apps and cheesecake or get cheesecake to go.

My experience at the ccf today was very disappointing....I was hoping to be blown away by the delicious food. But instead I got mediocre tacos that seemed tasteless and cold...no complaints about the chicken salad tostadas though, but still not mind blowned...it was super packed as usual, seemed a bit overpriced and noisy as fuck..service was good...mallparking garage was full and also had to pay which made my experience even more annoying... ive been to ccf in Braintree about 2 years ago and it was unbelievably awesome...maybe my next visit to this ccf will be better...ill be sure someone else treats me though.. 3 out of 5 stars thanks to the tostadas,lighting, couple hot waiters. And oh yeah godiva cheesecake was bomb!

Now I have been to Cheesecake Factory many times at home in California.  First time trying this location and  This time I am stopping by to leave a review. Six sassy gals decided to stop by last night for dinner and drinks. Now we were a but needy and a bit animated. We are in town for a convention.  We come every year in April. Big giant shout out to Jay for dealing with our antics with grace and a smile. We were a handful.  He is am excellent waiter who saw to our every need. Even recommended wonderful things for the undecided amongst us. I know we were overly excited to be in town and probably not the easiest group (vegans and vegetarians and drinkers lol). Thank you for your patience Jay. You rocked. We appreciated you.

One star for the extremely rude manager.  Our server Joselin F was five star but we are not rating her.  I am a person who eats out 3 times a week and orders one martini out per week.  I know what a martini tastes like.  My friend and I were away for a girl&#39;s night and went to the cheese cake factory.  My martini came and it did not taste like a martini, it tasted like water. I told the waitress and she was really sweet and got another one which came exactly the same.  Water with a slight taste of olives.  No problem we just said forget it I will order wine.  The manager came over when my friend and I were in the middle of eating and started lecturing us that if we want more alcohol we have to pay for it and this is how they always make martinis.  I have never seen such a thing and my hubby and I eat out all the time.  RUDE.  Would never go there again.  Our lovely server apologised for the nasty woman that had come to our table and we had a nice rest of our evening but that was so odd and weird and we have never experienced such a thing in our years of eating out.

I went here a few days ago and had a great time. The food was good, and our waiter was very attentive. As an added bonus, I took home some fried mac and cheese balls for my roommates. They got sick and accused me of poisoning them! ha! Good times at The Cheesecake Factory though. Will come back again.

Poor service tonight. One oder incorrect so had to wait 10 min to eat while waiting for correct meal.  Waiter forgot to bring bread to table and then remembered after about 7 min. Was told incorrect meal would be comped.  When check arrived there were 2 non-ordered meals on check. And, oh yes, they ran out of Mac and cheese dish initially ordered. No fun tonight at CCF. Doubt that we&#39;ll make it a priority choice in the future, even if the food is good there.

The worst experiences I&#39;ve had at a cheese cake factory. I really like this chain restaurant, however, this one was terrible. <br>First, after being seated we waited a while until a waitress came to great U.S.. She came around after about 10 minute saying she&#39;ll be back to take our drink order. Not a big deal. After she took our drink order an alarm and voice came over a loud speaker saying we should evacuate. The alarm went off a few times enough to annoy us. When the waitress came back with our drinks she explained what was going on and how the alarm system is connected to the mall. She then took our order. My friend was very specific in saying no onion and that he had an allergy. She acknowledge it and told him she make sure no onion. When we got our food, he had onion in his dish. They took the dish back. The waitress told him that she noted it when she sent the order in and apologized for the mix up in the kitchen. The manager came by after and apologized. We asked the manager for napkins because we all didn&#39;t have any. His dish then came as we were finishing but the napkins didn&#39;t. We had to ask twice. The manager comped the meal and apologized again. Overall it was a bad experience for us. For warning.

In a recent issue of Bon Appetit, Momofuku&#39;s David Chang picked the Cheesecake Factory as one of America&#39;s Top 20 Restaurants:  &#34;Cheesecake Factory. Seriously. They consistently make more people happy than any other restaurant. We can all learn a lot from them.&#34;  And CF was used by Dr. Atul Gawande in a New Yorker article as an example of consistently executing a complicated procedure.<br><br>Their endorsements are spot-on.  I had forgotten how pleasurable an evening at the Cheesecake Factory can be; I used to go there a lot in graduate school, but hadn&#39;t since.  I chose CF as the spot for our first dinner out with our new baby (3 weeks old at the time).  I figured we&#39;d get to sit down at a place with a menu, which would feel really nice after this transition to having a newborn.<br><br>It was a great night, with solid entrees and very courteous waitstaff.  Sure, the menu is huge and feels like a test sometimes, but there&#39;s something for everyone.  We had a great booth and there was just enough noise to cover a fussing baby, but so that my husband and I could have conversations that weren&#39;t just about bottles.<br><br>My only complaint:  no changing table in the men&#39;s room.  Come on, Cheesecake Factory, give moms a break!

Came here on Valentine&#39;s Day.<br><br>I have never ever EVER seen the Cheesecake Factory so packed in my life!<br><br>There was a line going out the door and the steps inside the restaurant were so packed you couldn&#39;t get by anyone.<br><br>I knew it would be pointless to try to get food so I ordered some cheesecake to go. I got dulce de leche, oreo, and banana cream.<br><br>Despite being packed, the staff was quick &amp; wrapped everything up pretty nicely.

This place ranks as the King of all chain restaurants.  If anyone dares to argue that, I have 14 pages of scrumdiddlyumptious menu items to prove otherwise.  The difficulty of going to CCF is that I&#39;m torn between getting something I know and love or trying something new and exciting. I left out a star because you really need to go during off-peak hours or else you are waiting a long time in a small space. Bar area seating is first come/first serve, but its like a hunting scene out of Discovery Channel...groups of people eyeing that ONE dirty table, and the people at that particular table seem like they will never leave.  Once they finally do, its a matter of who gets there first...<br><br>Also, ask for a booth, even if its an extra wait, it is worth the personal space. Nothing like New York bistro style dining...WHEN YOU&#39;RE IN NEW YORK.  <br><br>Here are a list of items that I&#39;ve had:<br>*small plates &amp; snacks/appetizers*<br>-edamame- perfectly salted, always plump<br>-ahi tartare- yummy, just a bit on the salty side<br>-mini corn dogs- mmmm good<br>-thai lettuce wraps- dont be fooled, in all its deliciousness, NOT low cal or low fat.<br>-buffalo blasts- think crab rangoon, but filled w/cheesy buffalo chicken.<br>-spicy ahi tempura roll- pretty good, t the 1st choice<br>-avocado eggrolls- makes the Chilis southwestern eggrolls look like cheap freezer food....oh wait, THEY ARE<br><br>*pizzas*<br>-they&#39;re all good, get one w/a side salad.<br><br>*burgers*<br>-factory burger- my favorite one! My man likes the classic burger. <br><br>*specialties*<br>-fish tacos- very tasty, beware of fried tortillas, so good they&#39;re bad<br>-bang bang chicken &amp; shrimp- think Thai food, spicy coconut based curry, veggies &amp; rice. Love it, one of my favorites!<br><br>*pastas*<br>-louisiana chicken pasta- spicy, cajun &amp; good. Fried chicken too greasy for my liking<br>-evelyns favorite pasta- fantastic vegetarian medley, tossed in light olive oil<br>-garlic noodles- one of my favorites, should be served w/a pack of gum<br><br>*seafood*<br>-miso salmon- my ALL TIME favorite dish. Its the perfect glazed salmon w/a creamy miso sauce, pea pods &amp; rice. <br><br>*salads*<br>-caeser- best one I&#39;ve had, I like the bite from the imense amount of garlic in the dressing. Also need a pack of gum<br>-chicken tostada salad- fabulous, if you like mexican <br>-weight management asian chicken salad- suprisingly delicious! I would definitely get this again<br><br>*a list of my favorite cheesecakes*<br>-reese&#39;s peanute butter chocolate  -lemon raspberry<br>-pineapple upside down                  -dutch apple caramel<br>-chocolate chip cookie dough         -pumpkin<br>-snickers bar                                   -oreo<br><br>The Lemoncello cream torte is light and fluffy if you want to stay away from the heavy cheesecakes.<br><br>I had breakfast there a couple of times and the omelettes were very good.  My favorite was the eggs benedict florentine w/spincah, bacon &amp; grilled tomato.<br><br>Drinks, well all I can say is the Ultimate Margarita is worth the price and gets you where you need to be. Strong, not like the crappy juice ones that you get anywhere else! Beware, margaritas tend to be high in calories (500+)<br><br>All in all, if you want to save money, go around lunch time. You ALWAYS get a heaping of food, but they have lunch portions available, I cant tell the difference either way.  You are more than likely going to take home the rest of your meal, unless you have a tapeworm problem or are training for the olympics. If you are not a leftover type of person, share your meal with someone. Either way, good food for a good price.  The 14 page menu can be confusing, but get a drink, nibble on their yummy bread and take your time.

So decided on Cheesecake Factory since we were at Providence place mall. Service was slow did get offered water or bread until I asked for both. They were out of a popular drink &#34;Pineapple Mojito&#34; didn&#39;t find out out until after I placed my order isn&#39;t this something the waitress should be aware of? Waitress didn&#39;t even suggest a different drink seriously wow! The sat us at the rear entrance I can count how many customers came in and stood lost waiting for service or to be seated, the staff was no help there was no sign directing the customers to the front if the Resturant completely horrible service!<br>On a brighter note the food was excellent and the cheese cake was to die for

Went there on a Saturday night around 7 with a group of 4 and was told the wait would be about an hour. The place was packed and all tables were full. An hour and a half and three rounds of drinks go by and we are still waiting to be seated at 8:30. The best part is, by this time, there were open tables available. We complained to the staff and all they could do was offer an apology. <br>The food was just as expected--mediocre. Despite the large menu selection, all of the food is overpriced, over portioned and overrated. <br>Providence is home to so many excellent restaurants--save your time and money and go elsewhere!

My boyfriend and I went here for my birthday on Saturday night and roughly waited around an hour. We parked in the north parking garage level 2 and it was an easy walk. I ordered the cajun jambalaya pasta which was very yummy and even better for leftovers (spicy). I got the seasonal pumpkin cheesecake that was absolutely delicious!

I went to The Cheesecake Factory when I was in town for business.  The food was good, the service was very poor.  I sat at the bar and there were two bartenders behind the bar.  When I sat down at the bar had two other people sitting at the bar and then me.  Later there was only one other person and myself.  It wasn&#39;t like it was very extremely busy at the bar.  Once I received my food and had several bites, one of the bar tenders asked how it was.  The two bartenders got talking that the customers were not receiving service.  I finished up and sat there watching them talking as I had my receipt and payment in my handle trying to get their attention. They continued to talk.  Finally I was able to get one of the bartenders attention and  made payment. Not once did one of the bartenders asked if I wanted dessert or anything else.

Horrible service. I had a birthday party dinner about 3 months ago and took almost 2 hours to get seated. Fine, we were a 6 people group. However, once we got to our table, the waiter didn&#39;t even bother to grab an extra chair in the 5person table. Moreover, once we received our order, we didn&#39;t get water refills nor any regular beverage refill until we were done with our food. Additionally, once we asked for the check, the waiter charged the group an extra 2 plates of food. IT TOOK ALMOST AN HOUR TO GET THE CHECK FIXED.  10/10 will not recommend
Great place for great food! We had Burger, Chicken Sandwich and Cheesesteak and my daughter said &#34;Dad, this was one of the best burgers I ordered this year!&#34;.
Cold centered meatballs in one dish the other dish soggy tortillas on fish tacos, horrible waitress leslie who double charged one dish,  never checked on our food and no drink refills
friendly service, good food.  we had to wait 25 minutes for a table but it was worth it.  they told us it would be 25 and it was exactly 25.  portions were big.

Yes, I know it&#39;s a chain, but I actually enjoy coming here. It&#39;s always super-busy, but you can&#39;t fault a restaurant for that. <br><br>I enjoy the interior with the light colored columns. It makes it seem more open and airy. <br><br>The food is a hair better than a TGIF or Not Your Average Joe&#39;s. The menu itself is huge and varied. A note to corporate- bring back your meatloaf sandwich and your chicken and biscuits.<br><br>Service is generally very good. <br><br>If you want an intimate conversation or to talk business, this probably isn&#39;t the best spot as its loud. However, if you want good good and service- this is great choice.
So they really screwed up. We took an outdoor table to save time and the kitchen messed up somehow. We waited an hour and a half for a salad and cold sandwich. The manager said sorry. Really?

The blonde lady at the front desk just had me standing there today like I was a lump of Cheesecake. I was ignored while waiting for service then she turned her back to chat with her co-workers. After I got tired of waiting  I asked if it was policy to ignore Black customers. Maybe I was right because she walked away without even acknowledging me and returned with her manager. I&#39;ll NEVER go there again.

Chain me up, tie me down and serve me some of the Cheesecake Factory. Yeah sure, its namesake slices are adventurous and perfect (that Oreo extreme cake they have going on literally tastes like a giant Oreo cookie), but there are other stars at the Factory.<br><br>The mushroom flatbread is on par with any sophisticated, pretentious flatbread served at one of those tapas restaurants. The dough is flat. The cheese is cooked just enough, and the mushrooms are bountiful. With a drizzle of truffle oil, these mini pizzas are wonderful appetizers not to be shared. You&#39;ll probably need two for a complete meal...or three, in case you need to offset that inevitable insulin rush from polishing off your Oreo cheesecake and part of a &#34;shared&#34; red velvet cheesecake for the table.

Moderately a good place to dine-in<br>My favorites from Cheesecake factory are the Bang Bang Chicken and Shrimp and the breads that they give to start off<br>But this place is usually very crowded during weekends so if you plan on going on the weekend, should plan well! As far as I remember they don&#39;t take reservations as well so..yeah.

Don&#39;t order to go food on a Sunday night ever!!!!! Awful service... we ordered two Kale salads and chicken pot stickers and a piece of cheese cake.. They just couldn&#39;t get it done!!! An hour later we had no food.. They gave us the wrong salads.. then they told us that they ran out of the pot stickers and the cheesecake... Of course...It was close to closing time....never again...

Told it would be 30 min. Wait and it ended up being 45 min. Witness multiple groups being seated before my group even though they checked in after I did with similar amounts of people.. I was standing near the check in counter. The Lady tried to lie and say it wasn&#39;t true when in fact it was then later states they were skipping us because we had a baby and they wanted to waited for a specific type of table which angered me since I knew I was right then they tell me I&#39;m wrong then basically admits they lied. As far as the food I ordered a burger and it was burned not chard but black burned on the bottom. You couldn&#39;t even taste that it was a burger just a burned hockey puck. I ask for it to be remade and it took forever. Between 45 min wait and the dining time we were there 2 hrs 50 min. That&#39;s insane because of how slow the whole process was. I tell them it&#39;s my wife birthday they said ok they will decorate the cheesecake and put a candle and sing well guess what.. they didn&#39;t they just brought it with no candle no decoration no singing. Very annoying experience. Then we get the bill and they over charged me for my horrible burger +$2 more than the menu says. Don&#39;t go there the food is not worth the prices they charge and the quality of the cheesecake isn&#39;t even in my top 5. Dave &amp; Busters has better food.

To start off, my boyfriend and I ordered the loaded baked potato tots, they took around 20 minutes to finally arrive at our table, despite being delicious and hot they tasted amazing. To order our actual meals we waited an hour after we ordered. Yes, ONE HOUR. Food was still good aside from my cold soup. Will most likely be returning.

Six weeks ago, I declared to my husband that when I finished my semi-torturous session of summer classes, we would go out to dinner (on a weekday night) to the one place we never go to since it is way too busy on weekends but that we both mutually love and adore- the Cheesecake Factory! See, here in Providence, there is only one Cheesecake Factory, and it is epically busy on weekends, to the point you usually have to wait an hour or two if you go around a normal dinner time. We typically get there at least twice a year, but this year, we haven&#39;t gone once yet! In fact, since I became vegan in December, the Cheesecake Factory has been off of our radar!<br> <br>Well that all changed on Wednesday night.  We didn&#39;t get there until about 8:30, and there was still a fifteen minute wait.  I wasn&#39;t sure how much I would still be enamored by the Cheesecake Factory now that I avoid dairy and gluten, but after my experience there, it is safe to say the Cheesecake Factory remains at the top of my chain restaurant list!<br> <br>They brought out their famed pumpernickel and sourdough bread and butter, both of which I passed on but did have a love affair with in my gluten-eating days! <br><br>We started with their made-to-order guacamole, and I asked that they leave out the sour cream in favor of double salsa.<br> <br>The guac is outstanding! We ordered it spicy, and while it wasn&#39;t really, it did have a nice kick that reared itself periodically. It was uber-flavorful though- way better than any store-bought guac I have tried, and honestly, it was better than the guac I get at my favorite Providence Mexican restaurant!<br> <br>Of course, no guac is complete without an endless supply of salty, crunchy tortilla chips!<br> <br>For dinner, I ordered their &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; fresh vegetable salad. Now a word on this &#34;Skinnylicious&#34; business- I think the only difference between this and their regular fresh vegetable salad is the pomegranate dressing is low-fat in the Skinnylicious version. Honestly, I could have cared less if I got the Skinnylicious version or the regular one, but since the lower-fat option was available, I went with it. <br> <br>I did make some changes to the original salad- I asked that they leave off the cheese and grilled chicken, and instead add some pecans and dried cranberries. Out waitress warned us there was an extra charge for that, which I thought was silly because I was essentially just making swaps, but whatever- I did it anyway!<br> <br>The salad was. . . astoundingly gigantic, to say the least! It was an awesome mix of greens, edamame (yay for vegan protein in a chain restaurant salad!), apple, cucumber, tomato, green beans, beets, pecans and cranberries. Everything was chopped into perfect bite-sized bits, and the pom dressing covered every single component perfectly. I have to say, this salad was epic (been using that word a lot in this post!) and incredible and I am sad I was only able to eat about a sixth of it!  <br><br>The reason I couldn&#39;t devote my full appetite to the salad was because my husband and I made an ordering oopsie. He got a burger, and asked that the fries be on a separate plate so I could have some. However, I had my eyes set on sweet potato fries, so of course, I ordered them too! <br><br>You figured out what our oopsie was right? Talk about over-ordering! My order of sweet potato fries was about double the size of the ones he got, which in and of themselves were quite plentiful in the fry department! In other words, we had fries up the ying-yang, and since they don&#39;t come home as leftovers as well as my salad would, I had to prioritize and keep my focus on fry consumption. Ok, when you have fries this crispy-on-the-outside and gooey on the inside, perhaps my dilemma wasn&#39;t entirely so bad! I ate a load of fries, and they were so tasty, but truth be told, there still was a load or two left!<br> <br>I am upset with myself that my stomach shut down so quickly.  On a good day, I could have eaten so much more of those delectable sweet fries drowned in ketchup. Back in the dairy-eating days, I would always follow up my meal with a huge slice of either the peanut butter cup or Oreo cheesecake. I am actually glad (for my stomach) that I didn&#39;t even have that option last night, as I don&#39;t think following up that enormous meal with cheesecake is what I needed at all!<br> <br>The Cheesecake Factory, in my opinion, is like the Bentley of chain restaurants. The food is always so consistently delicious- in all my times going there since it opened in Providence years ago, I have never had an experience with their food that was less than stellar.with their food that was less than stellar. I am so glad to know it is quite possible eat there as a vegan and be beyond satisfied.

Food and dessert were great, but wish they would post the alcoholic drink prices on the menu.   $11.50 for a Sangria and another $11.50 for a mixed drink!   That&#39;s insane, seeing it&#39;s about the cost of a meal!   Normally these should not be more than $8 at any other place...

This was my first time here and I was not disappointed. It was pricey and a looong wait time, but I think quality food is worth waiting for and paying for. That shit ain&#39;t free. <br>I have personally worked in the back kitchens of several cheesecake factories and they are super clean and professional. They actual have a crew come in and clean up overnight. <br>The bbq ranch chicken salad was the bomb. The kids pizza was on point. And of course the cheesecake was classic and delicious. I&#39;m looking forward to going back.

This place is awesome. Sometimes the wait can be obnoxious and their wait area could use some extra space. The menu is expansive and they are very good with your requests/modifications. Cheesecake is great as well with a flavor for everyone. Have never tried their breakfast but they serve that as well. They also serve moist towels for after the lettuce wraps. A nice touch.

If the food was not worth it I would not keep coming back. Every SINGLE time I have dined here, the experience has been awful. Today I went for lunch and was told I was not able to sit outside because there were no servers scheduled for the patio. However it was set up with table settings&amp; umbrellas. Being a server, any restaurant I have ever worked at would be more than happy to accomodate guests that wanted to sit outside and send a server out for them. It was a beautiful day out and we picked cheesecake factory specifically so we could sit outside and enjoy our meal and the weather. We were in line at the host stand as she greeted the party that came in behind us FIRST. No big deal, we went to sit in the self seat high top tables near the bar. After waiting a good amount of time to be greeted, we got our food in. Our meals came out SEPARATE because our server assumed we were sharing our meals we ordered separately?again we stayed patient. When mine came out we did need refills and extra sauce that we were never able to get. We also wanted to order dessert but before we could our server told us he was bringing the bill over. At this point we were pretty annoyed so we just got one slice of cheesecake to go. I was also charged $3.50 for a soda WATER? Its still water but when I asked the server about it he was extremely rude. If this was a one time thing I wouldnt have wrote a review but this is the service I always seem to get. Very dissapointing!!!

9 of us went there last night for my granddaughter&#39;s 16th birthday. We were seated fairly quickly, but it all went down from there. Service was very slow. We ordered our meals and waited quite a while before we got our meals. My father never got his. When The manager came over and apologized for not getting his chicken salad sandwich we told him it was chicken Parm. He said he would personally take care of it. Half hour later no sandwich.  Both were very apologetic waitress and manager but no sandwich. He finally got it boxed up when we were ready to Leave. When he got home and saw it it was so burnt he could not eat it. My meal was called but if I said something I knew I would not get fed that night so I ate it. My husband wrapped up his large portion of fish and chips and when he get home the only thing in the bag was the coleslaw. He asked for the coleslaw separate but not completely without the meal! Tried calling restaurant twice since then And ask for a manager but manager never comes to phone. Still the company was wonderful and we enjoyed it but do not think we will go back there again. The manager did take that the sandwich off the bill and along with a couple of other desserts.

You go here and the wait time is too long for you try and get a seat at the bar. Always a great experience talking to the bartenders and staff and much quicker service. Great food great atmosphere and always consistent

The menu is just too much! It seems the few times I have been at a Cheesecake Factory the menu just gets bigger. Honestly, just stick with the cheesecakes. <br><br>The wait is also a drawback to going here. The staff was fine although I did have 2 different servers, I think my first server needed a smoke break because when she did come back towards the end of the meal she reeked of smoke, distasteful! <br><br>From now on cheesecake to go only.

We came to the Cheesecake Factory for a late lunch/early dinner and our experience was so delightful. Our server Jay brown ( I believe his name was ) was a great server and did everything to make our experience as best as possible! Continuously making sure everything was up to par and boxing our food for us and insisting on making sure we had all the sauces that it was served with! We will be making another trip back!

Overall our experience at the cheesecake factory was very good. The place was very clean, the service was very fast and accurate. The waiter was very knowledgeable he knew the menu very well(on point). The floor manager was very friendly and informative when we asked questions for our project. The drinks were very slow coming from the bar, we got our appetizers first. But the entrees came out very fast and hot. The presentation of the food was very impressive food overall was very good. The portion sizes were not lacking- they were a generous size.<br><br>Drinks; Pina colada- this was very sweet needed to dilute with water, Pomegranate Mojito and Mai Tai.<br><br>Appetizer- Fried Calamari.<br><br>Entrees- Fried Shrimp with coslaw and fries,Pork chop with spinach and mashed potatoes, Hibachi steak with mashed potatoes and tempura fried asparagus.<br><br>Cheesecakes go)- Smores ,White Chocolate Carmel  Macadamia nut,Fresh Banana Cream.

I&#39;ve been to a few locations, but this one really takes the (cheese)cake! While the food was as good as it always is, what put this restaurant over the edge was the service. Our waitress in particular was a pleasure. So sweet and helpful, she helped my boyfriend sort through a bunch of enticing options for dinner and suggested drinks that we loved! Kept the water glasses full for the whole night and never let her smile slip from her face. Couldn&#39;t have been happier with that service!<br><br>Only slight problem was that they were out of the strawberry cheesecake that we wanted, because they didn&#39;t have any that was defrosted (apparently CF serves frozen cheesecake?), but we subbed a different kind and it was magically taken off our bill! What a nice surprise :)

My date and I arrived around 8:15 this past Saturday night expecting an hour wait or so, but because of the holiday weekend (I&#39;m guessing?!) we were at our table right around 8:45. The host was so polite, sat us in a booth with a window overlooking the State House /State Offices. She asked us if we were in town to see the &#34;WaterFire&#34; which was happening a block or so away, and when I kinda gave her the &#34;huh?!?&#34; face she gave us the details of what was going on.. she didn&#39;t throw the menus on the table and just run away.. it was really nice of her. She definitely likes her job and it shows.<br><br>Our server (Nicole?) was awesome, gave us time to look at the menu, made suggestions/answered questions for my SO (his first time there!??!) and made sure we were always being checked on, had water filled, plates cleared, etc. I always get the Thai Lettuce Wraps for dinner, he had Buffalo Chicken Blasts, Caesar Salad, and the Filet Mignon. Everything was so good, came out at the correct staggered times, cooked properly, etc. Instead of cheesecake we both had a Georgia Peach cocktail, consisting of vodka, and frozen raspberry + peach puree swirled all around in a snifter with a huge piece of mint. It literally tastes (and looks!!) like a yummy, frozen peach.. so good on a Summer&#39;s night.<br><br>We took the advice of out server and host and checked out WaterFire. I guess it was the first lighting of the season and I&#39;m glad they mentioned it to us. Made for a great end to our date.<br><br>If I had anything to suggest.. I&#39;d ask that a $30 filet be served with mashed potatoes and asparagus (or any vegetable, really) and NOT a big bowl of french fries topped with onion strings. Just sayin&#39;.. = )

I&#39;ve never had a bad experience at that  place. The bread was amazing, my entree was great rice with black beans, shrimp and sweet plantains. The decor of course was marvelous and our waitress was over the top friendly actually to friendly. She came every 5 mins to ask if everything was going great and I&#39;m not exaggerating either

I&#39;ve never liked how you cannot make a reservation at Cheesecake Factory but I had a gift card to use so I went with my girlfriend. We got a table after a 30 minute wait (had a drink at the bar in the meantime). Our server was friendly and told us the &#34;special&#34; was Mediterranean mahi-mahi with mashed potatoes. Turns out that was just an unlisted menu item and that the real special was catfish. Since she didn&#39;t think it was a good dish she didn&#39;t offer it. I actually kind of liked her honesty about this. We both took her preference of the mahi-mahi and it was fantastic. I added a star for her service and care.<br><br>The menu is a bit too extensive making it difficult to decide. The Lemondrop I had at the bar tasted too much like lemonade - I wouldn&#39;t recommend it.

We have been to the Cheesecake Factory so many times and it has never been as good as it was tonight. It is all because of our server Lauren. I think her last initial was L as stated on the receipt. Management should recognize what an asset they have because some of their other servers are definitely lacking. They could take a few pointers from her. She was so attentive and always made sure we had what we needed. The food was great and portions were huge. Just on tonight&#39;s experience alone I would recommend this restaurant to anyone. You have Lauren to thank for that!

It was my first visit to any Cheesecake Factory restaurant and must admit it was a terrific experience. From the Spinach and Cheese dip appetizer bursting with tasty and tender artichoke hearts, all the way to our one-of-a-kind signature cheesecake dessert selections (Kahlua!), we were impressed. Somewhere in the middle, I feasted upon beautifully prepared Steak Diane medallions as my wife battled a monstrous and delicious Burrito Grande, much of which shared the ride home with us. The atmosphere is attractive and tastefully backlit, but the dining room feels squeezed and is fairly noisy. Yet even on a Friday evening before Valentine&#39;s Day, the staff hustled us in without a wait and provided impeccable service.

I just wanted to comment on the experience that we had on the 16th of this month.  My wife&#39;s birthday.  First off the waiter Jeremy F was rude and only came to the table really once or twice to get the order and ask if we wanted desert.  I wanted a little cheese for my scampi but never had the chance to even ask.  I have never in my life been so disappointed on going out to a place for a birthday.  69.77 on the bill and it wasn&#39;t even close to be worth that.  Mine a Steak and Shrimp combo for 19.99 didn&#39;t even come with a vegetable.  The wife&#39;s food Chicken Madeira was great and came with everything seemed to be worth the money.  The biggest problem was the service and i&#39;m very disappointed in this.  I will be sharing this complaint on yelp also.

I&#39;ve been to the cheesecake factory on multiple occasions over the years. I enjoy their huge selection and being a vegetarian, it&#39;s nice to go to a chain restaurant that has more than two vegetarian options on the menu. Their cheesecake is delicious, the only cheesecake that I will eat. They also have delicious pasta dishes like Garlic noodles and Evelyn&#39;s pasta which I usually get. Their raspberry lemonade is divine and their crispy artichoke hearts are the perfect appetizer.<br><br>Just recently I went to the cheesecake factory with my boyfriend and I decided to try some new items off the menu. I got the farro salad which was absolutely delicious and unique with chewy farro, sweet beets, goat cheese feta, tomatoes, and crunchy english cucumbers. The salad was refreshing and as a small plate, just the right portion. In addition I also got the Sweet corn tamale cakes, which were also very unique. These mexican style corn cakes had a very yummy salsa verde, fresh pico, and creamy avocado pieces on top. However without the sauce the cakes tasted a tad bit too sweet and would have tasted better if they were cooked crispier and weren&#39;t so soggy.<br><br>My boyfriend enjoyed his food for the most part, I believe he got the steak diane. On the downside however, our waitress was terrible. She put items down and ran away and was the slightest bit personable. I had to talk to two other male servers to get the lowdown on the tamales, assuring me that they were good. When I asked her she gave me a blank stare and seemed unsure in her answer to my question. she cleared our plates promptly, but didn&#39;t posses the best people skills.<br><br>You usually cannot go wrong with the cheesecake factory, the only huge problem usually is the long wait. I get impatient when I&#39;m hungry and this is probably one of the only negatives about cheesecake besides the occasion rude waiter.

Returned and had the kale salad and the herb crusted salmon. No space for desert. Kale salad was a good size and tasty. Salmon was tender and tasty and large. This place serves big portions by my standards. Service was a lot better this time, not pushy but polite and not rushed.  Food came out in a timely manner.  Setting was nice. Go for a booth on the elevated level which has more privacy.  Price, about $30 per person for appetizer and entre including taxes and tip. Safe, not adventurous menu options.

Daily Lunch special is offered until 3.  My moms favorite place for her Renee chicken salad.   My sons favorite dessert spot especially the fresh strawberry cheesecake.  Great spot for a bite for lunch.
Dinner was amazing.  The Thai shrimp was tasty with just right amount of spices,  Service was fabulous,  very helpful with finding my sons phone.

In a city with as many amazing restaurants as Providence, there is absolutely no reason to go to a place as horrific as the cheesecake factory.  But people do, and I just don&#39;t get it.  <br><br>I&#39;ve been there about three times and it is always jam-packed with people.  It&#39;s like the mall at christmas time every day in that restaurant.  Here&#39;s just a short list of why the Cheesecake factory is crap.<br><br>Overpriced.<br>The food is mediocre.<br>The decor is atrocious.<br>It is incredibly loud. <br><br>And my biggest complaint--the unforgiveable--<br><br>THERE ARE ADVERTISEMENTS IN THE MENU (sorry to shout)<br><br> As if it&#39;s not annoying enough to pay those kind of prices for lame food, they are actually trying to sell you things right there as you decide on what to eat.  I found that so appalling that I actually wrote an email to the company.  They replied with: <br>&#34;Thank you for e-mailing us regarding your dining experience at our Providence<br>Cheesecake Factory restaurant. I apologize that you were offended by the advertisements in our menu. For the past 20 years we have included advertisements to promote area businesses and to compliment our &#34;book-style&#34; menu. It was not our intention to offend you. I will certainly share your comments with our company executives.&#34;<br><br>The ads are not for area businesses, they are for handbags, cruises and the like.  And how does adding ads make something &#34;book-style&#34;?  Books don&#39;t have ads, you morons, magazines do.<br><br>I have more complaints about this business, but I&#39;ll just link to them: <a href="/redir?url=http%3A%2F%2Fladyandria.wordpress.com%2F2008%2F07%2F21%2Fthe-best-macaroni-cheese-in-providence-outing-three-cheesecake-factory%2F&amp;s=85cd8759d1866ffb8b11d4dfa8451b414e4ae4e575f41e9a66a1f44c5884d757" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">ladyandria.wordpress.com…</a>

Saturday afternoon- busy if not the busiest part of the day, I understand... I was going to be at an event within walking distance to the restaurant.  I called at 10am to see if they accept advanced dining reservations for a party of 15-20.  They said no... No problem!  We were planning on coming around 1:30pm so I asked the lady on the phone what the best course of action would be seeing as about 8-10 of the diners would be 7 year olds and I was trying to avoid a long wait.  She said call back at noon and see if there is a wait.  If there is, walk over and put our name on the list so the restaurant could prepare.  Brilliant!  No problem!  Call at noon, the gentleman says come down and get a buzzer.  Go and grab a buzzer and they say 1-2 hour wait- perfect!  Event is over in an hour!  This is terrific I&#39;m thinking.  Go back in an hour and a half and they say if we all want to sit together it will be a 3 hour wait... WHAT?!!!!!!!  I&#39;m sorry but when you make a reservation/ put your name in for a party of whatever number it is, don&#39;t you typically want to sit together?!!!!!!  Fine, it was Saturday afternoon but SOMEONE could&#39;ve informed me one of the many times I called that morning.  If you have a large party- SKIP THE CHEESECAKE FACTORY PROVIDENCE PLACE!

How to begin... Have eaten at the Cheesecake Factory several times as a matter of fact their avocado egg rolls were in my dreams when I was pregnant ;)<br>On my last visit we had a group of 4 and were very hungry so we sat on the bar side and was not expecting the same service as the dinning area, but to our surprise we had an awesome waiter! He was at our service and very attentive to what we needed as a matter of fact when our food arrived my so unfolded his napkin to get his fork and by accident dropped his knife, our waiter was there in a flash! And said &#34;I heard a knife drop&#34; and handed my son another :D <br>So to put it in a nutshell I will be returning, the only reason I did not give them 5 stars is due to the long wait and crowd but who can blame anyone, food is great and service as well.

Never disappointed when we go to the Cheese Cake Factory. The food, service, and atmosphere are always excellent. Tonight our server Joan was awesome. She was very attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. She suggested the chicken Madeira which was fantastic. Can&#39;t wait to come back!

Food is great.   Hostesses are rude.  25 minutes to get a a glass of water after seating.  30 minutes just to get the receipt cashed out to sign.  Actually still sitting in the car with kids waiting for my fri be to pay the bill. Unfortunately I will be back cause food is great.  Wish service was as good as the food!! Something for management to consider!!

I usually love the Cheesecake Factory. I went in last Friday with a co-worker who took me out for lunch for my birthday.  We arrived at noon and seated promptly. When we were seated it took a bit for our server to arrive but I didnt think anything of it.  Then we ordered water and waited and waited.....I said to my friend &#34;why is it taking so long for water&#34; when it finally arrived. Since we have an hour for lunch we gave the waitress our orders at that time.  We each had a salad.  Then we waited and waited again....no salads....no waitress...nada until 12:40....as I was watching my clock. When she brought the salads. I said &#34;that was a very long wait for salads&#34;.  I was shocked with her reply....&#34;I will get you the manager&#34;. There was no...&#34;I&#39;m sorry for the delay&#34; or anything like that.  Plus, I didnt even ask for the manager.  During the next 10 min, no manager came by, no waitress either to see if we needed anything, to ask if everything was ok, etc.  She came back and said &#34;did the manager come by?&#34;  and I told her no.  The manager finally came by and I explained what happened. He said, sorry and left. I think the waitress should find another line of work or something.

Visited this location after a show at a local theater - and we were looking to have a quick bite so we could get back home to relieve the babysitter. <br>Unfortunately we had a 30min wait - but seeing the bakery area where they display all those Devine cheesecakes - we held on.<br>First and foremost our waiter was fantastic - we let him know we were running short on time - and he worked his magic with getting bread and drinks on our table in a flash. I know that this sounds too good to be true - but we got our meals within 10 min of order - I was shocked! <br>I ordered the Asian lettuce wraps and I was more than pleased (ordered a light dinner as I knew that trying some of their legendary cheesecake was in my definite future). The chicken was grilled perfectly and coated in a delicious  sauce. The Bibb lettuce was crisp and held the ingredients well. The two sauces they offered were a great compliment to the dish.<br>My husband ordered a bacon cheeseburger with fries and he actually commented that they cooked it the way he ordered it - amazing as he hasn&#39;t had that happen in a long time. Due to the rapid disappearance of his burger I noted he was enjoying it - one thing that really impressed me was the thick cut bacon they used (not that thin crappy kind you get at other places).<br>The waiter was so attentive to our need to scoot outta there - he gave us our bill without prompting and delivered two ice teas in take out cups for our ride home. I could have hugged this guy he was so good.<br>Now we had pre-planned that dessert was going to happen but we needed it packed - so when we got home (and our stomachs had settled) we got to enjoy the real star of the night. Godiva chocolate cheesecake and Tiramisu cheesecake - it was so rich you just can&#39;t finish the slice. They prepare the take home slices with the sauces and whip cream so they do not spare the details - which makes this dessert a must try!!!

Forgetting that July 4th means most non-chain/franchised restaurants are closed, my mom came down for a day trip visit and we opted for the Cheesecake Factory -- she had never been there before and I&#39;ve always had a decent meal there.<br><br>Well, this CF was the best one I&#39;ve been to. I&#39;ll start with the service -- the host was very gracious, and we had a phenomenal server who offered my mom a great recommendation (she got the navajo and LOVED it). My water was always full, and everything came in a timely manner.<br><br>Now the food. I was torn between using the skinnylicious menu (yes, that is right, they have an entire menu of &#34;healthy&#34; options -- everything under 590 calories for an entree -- and all delicious) or the regular menu. I opted for the skinny version of the veggie burger (which is the same veggie burger on the regular menu, sans cheese). It was not your traditional gross microwaveable patty. It had farro, brown rice, beets, and some other ingredients -- and was absolutely delightful. And healthy. <br><br>After dinner we both ordered our cheesecake. Yes, they are a bit pricier, but I&#39;m a dessert person and it is always fantastic, so I didn&#39;t mind spending more on something I really enjoy. <br><br>While yes, the menu can be a bit daunting, there is literally something for everyone at a reasonable price. But come here if you are looking for consistency and quality food -- and any kind of cheesecake you&#39;d like :)

DID SOMEONE SAY CHEESECAKE?! I don&#39;t know about all of you, but my girlfriend and I sure love cheesecake, but honestly that is probably the only thing that is actually really good at this restaurant.  I normally order the burrito grande and allows enjoy it and the food seems to be just above average for the rest of the menu from what I here from friends and those whom we eat out with.  Honestly I believe some of the meals are overpriced and the service as been diminishing since this place became so well known.  My girlfriend and I went here this past Friday with two friends of ours and left not as satisfied as we expected.  I ordered the burrito, like I said, and she ordered the eggplant parm.  My meal was very good and filling and was at a cost of around $15.  Her meal was similar in price; however, the eggplant was very dry, the pasta was plain, and there wasn&#39;t much sauce that came on it at all.  Overall she was not satisfied with the meal she had gotten.  My friends ordered two pasta dishes and seemed to enjoy them enough; however, weren&#39;t ecstatic about their meals either.  We started off the meal with the traditional bread which is allows some that that is great to hold you over before a meal.  We also ordered the nachos and my two friends bought two beers to start as well.  The nachos were pretty good; however, it took an extremely long time to get them and that something that simply shouldn&#39;t occur with an appetizer.  My friends beers were at a cost of $9 which is a little pricey especially for the common beers that they chose. The beers took over 15 minutes to get to the table and that is another thing we were disappointed in.  The server seemed like a robot not really caring about what we wanted, but more so focusing on giving some what of an automated and typical  introduction of the menu.  She was polite; however, very slow.  We all ordered cheesecakes to go and three of us had meals to take home.  The server took each plate and wrapped them for us, but when she gave them back to us she handed them to us individually and when we all got home we realized she had given two of us the wrong meals.  We had already parted ways at this point so we weren&#39;t able to switch them back.  The cheesecake was very good as it always is.  I had the red velvet cheesecake and Tori had the Oreo cheesecake and they were both very good.  Honestly this place has changed since it began and not in a good way.  Overall the food was subpar for what you pay for, but the cheesecake was still good.  I&#39;m not sure if I will come back again due to the bad service and average food, but I may be back just for the cheesecake because that is the one category they never disappoint me with.

Great for the average college kid.<br><br>Used to come here all the time on weekends for 1 serving of dinner that fed me through late Friday night to early Sunday morning. Love their cheesecake.... OMG... so delicious... ugh so bad for my hips.

There is no Cheesecake Factory in my everyday life, so when I travel, I try to find a local Cheesecake Factory. I&#39;m addicted. I always order a small meal because it&#39;s all about the cheesecake. In this case, I ordered the sausage and ricotta flatbread and the Chris&#39;s Outrageous Cheesecake. Both were exceptional. The flatbread had just the right amount of ricotta - enough to taste yummy but not so much to make the flatbread mushy. As an added bonus there was a little spinach. That was a surprise that tasted so good. I was catching a flight a little later, so I ate part of my dessert there and took the rest with me. Both servings were so good. Chris&#39;s Outrageous has tons of chocolate, some coconut, and real cheesecake. It&#39;s truly wonderful overkill. If you like Cheesecake Factory, you&#39;ll like this one. It&#39;s a little out of the way in the mall (hard to find) and the service was average, but overall a good experience.
i&#39;ve been twice.   Once was great. Once i had to complain about our service and food. <br>Its overpriced. The desserts are spectacular.  Skip the meal and just get the dessert....to go.

So the Cheesecake Factory is one of those places at Providence Place that I avoid like crazy. It always seems overly busy, the menu is unruly, and it&#39;s pricey. Somehow I found myself at the mall with my mom just before noontime on a weekday and it was my first choice for lunch. As I&#39;d hoped, it wasn&#39;t too busy. I limited myself to the one page lunch menu and chose a lunch-sized salad. This was an incredible salad. It was huge, dressed perfectly, and the ingredients were fresh and tasty. I love salad but I don&#39;t usually order it in chain restaurants because they are too often overdressed or limp. Cheesecake has amazing salads. I got a slice of pumpkin cheesecake to go because I couldn&#39;t help myself. It was ok, probably not worth the $8.
Overpriced mediocre food with terrible customer service.  There are better places to eat in the immediate area.

My friend and I never been so we decided to finally use the gift cards our boss gave us. Well providence plaxe mall parking sucks. the wait was way too long. Service was mia. For first time guests atleast help us out and describe the items on the menu.  Macaroni and cheese balls were melt in your mouth amazing! Drinks average. Cheese cake was delicious! Even though we had gift cards the price was way too high. Next time I will take them macaroni and cheese balls to go

Arrived on a Sunday afternoon at 3:30 for a late lunch and was seated within 5 minutes just as the hostess said, Which was surprising as the place was packed and numerous folks standing around waiting for tables. <br><br>We were greeted promptly and given bread and butter along with our one water and club soda. <br><br>Placed our order for a chicken sandwich and white chicken chili.<br><br>Our sever came along to let us know of a shift change and introduced us to our new server.  He offered more bread and a refill on our drinks which we declined.<br><br>It&#39;s now going on 40 minutes since we&#39;ve placed our order.  Our original server was still in the area and I asked her why she was still here.  She replied that she can&#39;t leave until all her pending orders are served.  She told us she would go check on our order. <br>Our new server came along again and said he just checked and found that the sandwich was ready but there seemed to be a problem with the chili.<br><br>From my experience, chili, along with soup are items already prepared and just waiting to get bowled up.<br><br>Along comes the manager who begins the conversation with &#34;your food will be out shortly&#34;.  Not an apology, no offer to get us something while we continue to wait.  We commented that it had been 45 minutes since we ordered and he appears to get all defensive as if we just insulted him personally.<br><br>He walks away and still 5 more minutes pass when the new server comes along again with no food.  We tell him we are not willing to wait any longer and to get our check.  He says he will be right back with it.  I couldn&#39;t believe he was actually going to bring us a check for club soda. <br><br>We threw a $5 on the table and left, never to return.

I&#39;ve been here several times with my wife and I should have written this sooner. It&#39;s a chain and I was a bit leery if the great food and great service would be consistent and it was excellent each time we went. Noticeably so, was the outstanding bartender Josh. We&#39;ve had him a few times on our visits and he has a perfect personality for his job. He was outgoing and very professional.
